Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: luvtogo6
Reviews.Content: Inexpensive and good location for the city. The room was clean, spacious and all the mod cons. The location is very close to Liverpool St, and Moorgate stations. Barbican and Hoxton close by. Good transport connections, both tube and bus. Good bar in the hotel, bar open 24 hours for guests. Nice bars close by but a reasonably quiet area close to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, located within the financial district”
Reviews.Author: RoamingWayfarer
Reviews.Content: I needed to find a hotel convenient to the financial district on a weekday night, at short notice. My internet searches were coming up with rooms starting at 200+ that were convenient, otherwise long journey times in order to find affordable rooms. Fortunately I stumbled upon this Travelodge! Within walking distance of my appointment and affordable! I checked-in after 22:00 and had a top-floor room facing the inner courtyard - which was really quiet. The room was equipped for the disabled This meant the room was enormous, had one chair and the bathroom basin is situated very low down. There are a choice of coffee shops and other eateries within 2 minutes walk - if you want an alternative to the Travelodge Bar Cafe.

Reviews.Title: “clean and efficient hotel in good location for tube”
Reviews.Author: Davebof
Reviews.Content: Everything was spotlessly clean and well maintianed. V easy walk from Liverpool st. Staff were friendly and receptionist gave my mum a rose (it was mothers day). The room did not have much character but the bed was comfy and we slept very well.

Reviews.Title: “Good breakfast & efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: Crackerkeighley
Reviews.Content: Booked last minute train & accomodation only travel lodge left around London but what a good travel lodge good breakfast bacon sausages tomatoes eggs toast cereals cakes tea coffee juices etc staff very helpful .stayed two nights room cleaned between nights tea & coffee in rooms flat screen tv because it was the weekend it was quite outside & local bars restaurant were shut and only open through the week under ground stations nearby moorgate Liverpool &old street station bad point early booking in charge 10 pounds but air dryers are free for 45 mins at reception bar is open 24hrs but a bit sole less & bar food average can get noisy at night when partys return but we had no problem or with noise from sports bar our room nu was 405

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Kerry G
Reviews.Content: the hotel is only a 2 minute walk from Old Street tube station. The check in staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and exactly what you would expect from a Travelodge-small and basic. There was a 24 hour bar and complimentary tea and coffee in reception as well as facilities in the room. There was no noise at all-it was hard to believe we were in central London.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean, but not for me”
Reviews.Author: andrea386
Reviews.Content: I agree that if you book a Travelodge you should know what to expect, as per the title of my review it was basic, very basic, but it was clean. That would usually suit me, but this place has no soul. Endless corridors of rooms. White walls, white bedding, not a picture or any colour anywhere. The bed was fine. No soap in the bathroom. Room overlooked an office block. It was quiet tho, I understand rooms at the front have alot of traffic noise and deliveries to nearby shops start about 5am. Plan in advance if you want o dry your hair as you have to get a hairdryer from reception. There were tea and coffee facilities. Maybe the rooms are deliberately bland to make you spend time in the bar ! The bar area was OK, but not somewhere I would be able to relax. Breakfast selection was good, hot food looked OK tho I didn't have any, i just had cereal and toast, the tables weren't very clean, and the dining area had a grubby feel to it. I'd be more inclined to skip breakfast at the hotel @ £7.95, there are plenty of coffee bars, and shops to pick up breakfast from The staff I encountered were all friendly enough. It wasn't a bad stay, If you book early you might feel it's good value especially for London but for the price I paid I'm sure there is better in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for the tube, and a comfy bed.”
Reviews.Author: BloodyHollie
Reviews.Content: I like this Travelodge and often use it when I'm in London. The reason? It's usually very cheap, a short walk from either Old Street or Liverpool Street tubes, you've got a Tesco and a Sainsburys within 2 minutes walk, and a Subway opposite to get breakfast if you don't want it at the hotel. Lets face it, it's a Travelodge in Central London. What are people expecting?? If you want the facilities of a 4 star hotel, you've plenty of choices in London. You won't find it here, but you will find cheap, clean, comfortable accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID”
Reviews.Author: alnatcam
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst Travelodge I have ever stopped in. The receptionist said I wasn't booked in and started to charge me for an available room. I produced my email and she was quite annoyed that I had proof of my confirmation. The room was freezing cold and the noise outside was horrendous from the overnight roadworks. There was fighting and smoking in the corridor from others staying in the hotel. The bins were emptied noisily at 6am and the Tesco's next door got a delivery very soon after. When I triwd to complain on my check out the receptionist claimed she couldn't speak English. Travelodge refused to reimburse the price of the room until I threatened to take them to the small claims court. DO NOT STOP AT THIS HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Denton
Reviews.Content: As we was spending only one night in London we didnt wish to break the bank and plumbed for this hotel asit was near to the location we were visiting. The hotel is within walking distance of two tube stations one minutes from the main kings cross station. It was clean and tidy and looked like it had just been painted, our room situated at the rear of the hotel was clean and tidy with generla mod cons however there was two of us and only one towel which seems to be a common theme from previous comments. This was rectified by a quick trip to reception which also provided us with extra pillows which a wafer thin. The bed although comfy the mattress had seen some hammer and sagged in the middle and seemed to be cheap and nasty but clean. The breakfast was good and provided varying variety so no grumbles at all. The Harley did drive passed at about 7.30 which was a good alarm clock and would be street noise that would be around anywhere you stayed. For a base it was adequate and we didnt book for facitlities etc so other than the bed and pillows no problems staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: Bellydancer_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine for a one-night stay in London without having to break the bank. The rooms are basic but clean, breakfast is extra but was ok (if not a bit busy on Sunday morning). The hotel is near a couple of tube stations, a supermarket and various shops. It's a good location if you want to be near the city or are coming into town from the East.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent London Stay”
Reviews.Author: Robert E
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced and a new, clean Travelodge. Food available in-house. Superb location - 2 tube stations nearby, Tesco, Sainsbury and Co-op also close, with several coffee shops at hand. 10-15 minutes' walk to St Paul's and Millennium Bridge. First class for a no-fuss London stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Staff helpful & price made the stay even more enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: AnneWillis
Reviews.Content: Booked for 2 nights for my birthday with 2 other friends to see a show and sight see London (even though iv been LOTS of times its still one of my faviroute cities) We booked Early Check in (which id recomend to do at time of booking as Family/rooms for 3 get booked up quickly on this) and had breakfast on the first morning and we paid £35.00 each in total for the 2 nights. Iv stayed here before and again was not disapointed. I would not pay the rack rate or above the £60-£70 a night price mainly as you can get better in London for facilities etc but if your wanting a comfortable cheap place to pop your head down then this is perfect. People do complain about having bed linen in rooms and having to make up the spare beds.... Well initially the spare beds are the sofas and also couples book family rooms just for 2 on occassion therefore easier to have the linen available to dress as pleased. Bearing in mind Travelodge is a 'BUDGET ' hotel chain they cut their costs by id imagine sticking to a tight schedule along with no fluff and extras! We never had the linen in our room yet we booked a room for 3 adults. We did check in at 12 as we could on our early check in and the cleaner was on our floor doing other rooms so was easy enough to obtain the linen. We were out all day and into early evening and were back at the hotel for around 9pm. (no clubbing for me as 6 months pregnant lol) The beds were ok but we were on 1st floor at front of hotel. Bit noisy with traffic and people that had enjoyed a few drinks lol.... This did disturb our sleep but to be honest your staying in central london on a weekend so was to be expected. If this will ruin your stay i suggest requesting a quiet room (i have requested a quiet room overlooking what the receptionist said is courtyard area for when i stay again in April with my husband and 4 year old daughter as this may affect her nights sleep) The breakfast is typical Travelodge, and having experienced one last year at the Covent garden Travelodge we did opt to pre book again mainly as on our 1st morning we wanted to be up and out as we had purchased bus tickets on the 'Original tour' and wanted to make the most of our day. Its nothing special and im sure the scrambled egg is made from a powder form but for the bacon, bread, Croisants, yogurts, Muffins & cereals it was more than adequate, coffee tea & juices included as well. theres plenty of places outside the hotel to eat for lunches etc and there is a Tesco express couple doors down which was handy. Theres also places like Garfunkels and frankie & bennys that do 2 for 1 breakfasts/2 for £10 but would have to possibly get tubes or walk a bit further a field for those. The bar is 24hours and food & drinks can be got at all hours. On our 2nd night we had some friends also stay but as they were there for the nightlife we never really saw them. They had a few drinks in the bar and for central london the prices are reasonable. Considering the 24hour bar aspect we were not disturbed in our room and there is security at the reception (its not rowdy or anything, just think they are there for peace of mind) Overall if you were wanting a base and somewhere clean with access to central london it is perfect. I have also stayed at the Covent Garden Travelodge which is exactly the same as this one and just has the edge over moorgate but only for location... We saved about £50 by staying at Moorgate so thats the reason this one won this time (& when i go in April ) Remember you pay budget prices then expect a budget (clean) hotel

Reviews.Title: “Just what you need for a shopping trip!”
Reviews.Author: daniellarella13
Reviews.Content: Typical travel lodge, basic and plain but very clean. Staff at reception very lovely even gave us more tea and coffee and sorted out no towel problem quickly. If your just wanting a place to Rest your head it's perfect. For anything else I'd go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: vix17
Reviews.Content: We booked a family room for one night. When we got to the room (easy self-check in), we found they hadn't made up the sofa bed for the children. Not sure if you are supposed to make it yourself or if they had simply forgotten, but as the linen was in the room, it was easier just to make it up ourselves. there were also not enough towels for everyone, but as it was a late night for the children, we weren't too bothered about a bath & getting more towels. I did, however, ask for extra pillows, as we only had one each and they were extremely thin. The lady at the desk seemed unwilling to part with any and eventually gave us just one - rather poor, I thought. Other downsides were that the bed dipped in the middle and that the room was far too hot, even when the thermostat was turned right down. On the plus side, the location was great - near several tube stations and easy walk to lots of London attractions. The bar/reastaurant was reasonable priced and the food was nice enough, and breakfast wasn't bad value if you include the free kids' breakfasts. All in all, it wasn't the most comfortable or luxurious night, but for less than £60 for 4 people in the centre of London, you can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge Moorgate, Just border level location”
Reviews.Author: Maxsalut
Reviews.Content: The value per price is very low; the hotel is very essential, not always well cleaned, not class furniture; by the, it can work for a couple of night, as it is quit well located near to tube and buses; good restaurant, be careful to avoid busy time for breakfast.... too, too,many peoples...

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is....”
Reviews.Author: rhyd78
Reviews.Content: Was never expecting a huge amount but was very convenient to my place of business, clean and relatively comfortable. Reception staff were very friendly and effective and there's a decent cafe bar area open late to residents. The bar staff weren't brilliant but again for under £70 a night in the City what can you expect.

Reviews.Title: “One of the newer Travelodges - does what it says on the can!”
Reviews.Author: Ernie M
Reviews.Content: A good price & great location for working in and around the City of London. I received a very nice greeting on arrival - you know just genuine and honest - not stage managed. Asked for a quiet room and got top floor (7th) where at the end of the corridor, the room (718) was so quiet you could hear a pin drop. Not too bad on waiting for lifts either! Yes very basic stuff but very clean and although it was the coldest day in London this winter, the little electric heater coped fine. Also good hot food for breakfast. Only thing I could moan about was watered down orange juice but that's me just being pedantic. I'd definitely stay there again - rather than their other Branch down the road!!

Reviews.Title: “Usual Travelodge experience”
Reviews.Author: lemec79
Reviews.Content: Travelodge's are ok places for short stays. You can't really expect much. At the City Road hotel you get a pretty small room with the usual fairly spartan facilties, but clean. When I arrived in my room there was no toilet roll so I had to go and get some at reception. Room was quiet enough, though there was some sort of ventilation fan outside that was audible. Location is ok for the City, as you'd expect, though not so great if you want to go to West End and there's not much happening in the area at night. The restaurant serves decent enough food but the bar isn't the most atmospheric place to enjoy a drink. It's ok for a fairly central location, and about as cheap as it gets for central London, but doesn't exactly have character, but then that's not a surprise really.

Reviews.Title: “A good and quiet location in the City of London - walking distance to Liverpool Street”
Reviews.Author: Svanfolk
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a lot of Travelodges and I was definately pleasantly surprised by this one. It was clean and fresh and the staff were very helpful and friendly. I aksed for a quiet room and was given one on the 6th floor overlooking the central atrium - no view, but nice and quiet as requested. The Travelodge rooms are basic, but adequate for a couple of days. The bar & restaurant facility at this Travelodge is very good. I will definately stay here again next time I'm in London.

Reviews.Title: “Very average, although standards seem to be falling”
Reviews.Author: RobIpswich
Reviews.Content: Check in handled swiftly and efficiently by a friendly lady. Whilst checking in saw another guest come down and ask for a towel as there was none in her room: on arrival in my room, there was not one there either, so it was back down to reception to get one. Location is excellent, just a few minutes walk from Old Street and Moorgate underground stations, and not much further to Liverpool Street station for main line trains. It pays to ask for a room at the end of a corridor, as sometimes there can be a bit of noise at weekends from other guests returning from one of the many clubs in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go if paying full price”
Reviews.Author: Cumbrian67
Reviews.Content: Good points: Location, just a 5 minute walk from 2 tube stations & short journey into centre. Staff helpful & pleasant. Good value breakfast with plentiful hot & cold items on buffet. Bad points: Large double bed but unable to lie flat without rolling into middle. 2 of the thinnest pillows ever seen on bed with only 1 spare. Only 1 bath & 1 hand towel provided & both thin & rough. (We were however able to obtain extra pillow & towels from reception.) Woken 4.30am by lots of banging in corridor outside room which went on for over 5 minutes. No room phone & nothing with reception number on in room to enable call to security from own mobile. Thankfully we paid sale price. Would definitely not recommend staying here if had to pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Value room”
Reviews.Author: Peter J
Reviews.Content: On checking into the room the heater was on full, room was like sauna. Window safety locked hard to get fresh air in room to cool own. Mattress thin and springs very protrusive. Pillows like wafer thin ham. Shower cold , sink 10 minutes to drain. Location , good, staff on check in , Isabel , excellent. Manageress on departure dire! Paid 25 quid so not too disappointed, had I paid 100 I would have been annoyed!

Reviews.Title: “comfy bed !”
Reviews.Author: andrea k
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night on 29 jan, very clean comfy rooms good shower, tea coffee making facilities, good big comfy bed. Be aware though hotel is in the congestion zone and because of security, cannot lave bags in concierge. But can book in from noon onwards for an extra £10.Never have breakfast in these hotels, dont know why though cos its all you can eat for around £8 looks good too.Try it.

Reviews.Title: “Trip of a lifetime.....”
Reviews.Author: PUG_123_12
Reviews.Content: Myself and 2 other 'people' stayed for 1 night only and what a treat it was. We checked in via a machine near the front desk but unfortunately it was too complicated for us to work out so had to queue at the reception and speak to a gorgeous young lady named 'Kinga' - she was not the one from Big Brother, wine bottle etc. We then went out for a couple of drinks and came back to find the room so hot that we were left with no option but to open a window and take all our clothes off. Fighting, spitting and a lack of hangers for our pants didn't dampen the mood though and we were quite pleased with the tv in the room to entertain ourselves. We only had 1 towel which was a bit disappointing but we took this out on the crockery. On the plus side we comfortably managed to fit 3 of us in the shower which was quite good for a bathroom which wasn't the biggest. There was a rather sour note the next morning however when one of our party was unfortunately left behind at the hotel as he was lying on the floor crying. He cried so much that there may be a bill to replace the wet carpet where he cried. Does anyone know if you're supposed to check out?

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Louise038
Reviews.Content: good value in the centre of London. The room was clean. I had asked for a quiet room, which it was. The breakfast was good value and a varied choice.Child under 15 eats for free with adult buying breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean rooms and pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: acjkt
Reviews.Content: I was in London for a few days for meetings, and chose this travelodge for its location. I intially was looking at Bank but it was already fully booked. The travelodge is equidistant from Moorgate and Old Street Underground stations and is fairly straightforward to find. Check in was quick, there was a queue when I arrived so I elected to use the self check in machines. It initially allocated me a room on the first floor, which given previous reviews and personal experience I asked to be changed before I even went to the room. The new allocated room on the sixth floor was spotlessly clean, had a bath (which I wasn't expecting) and was facing the road. I didn't get any noise except when opening the window there was traffic noise. The bed was however, very soft. I'm not a fan of soft beds but did sleep okay nonetheless. As with all travelodges, you pretty much know what to expect. I really only use them to sleep anyway so don't need all the other stuff that mainstream hotels provide. The breakfast was actually okay and fairly well organised. If you can get a reasonable rate online then give it a go. It's not in the West End and and the City area is practically deserted at weekends but you can get pretty much anywhere within 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Now with free slow wifi”
Reviews.Author: Gorey_Wexford
Reviews.Content: I last reviewed this in Nov 2007, I think this experience was a bit better. This suited us well. Reasonable prices for London (£80/night for room with breakfast for two), good enough buffet breakfast, close to Barbican centre and Liverpool St. Station. They gave us a room on the fifth floor facing the interior courtyard which was quiet enough for us. I opened the window a bit for more air but there is fan noise from outside. They do not hold luggage so bear in mind the extra £8.50 per item to store cases in Liverpool St. Station. They provide 512K wifi in the cafe, which suits fine for email or browsing for events on in London. If you want video conferencing or large email documents for work, you can pay for premium access in your room. That's a fair compromise.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: mcrmmay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the hotel based on rates and reviews seen here. It is budget hotel and people should know what to expect.We were not expecting much, but the hotel is very good.Location is great, close to two tube stations- Old street and Moorgate-, supermarkets and some stores. Receptions is busy as well as bar and restaurant, but they do their best to help you and ...with a smile. Even food is ok if you decide to eat at the hotel. There is free internet in the lobby. Definitely would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but very basic facilities”
Reviews.Author: Jane99048
Reviews.Content: The location was very convenient - good access to the City for work, however the rooms are very basic. Even when I piled up the 3 pillows that were in the room they weren't as thick as a standard pillow. They don't appear to have room service, however there is a min Tescos and a large M&S nearby if you want to eat in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money and loction.”
Reviews.Author: Bradders33
Reviews.Content: I was wondering what to expect after reading the mixed reviews on here.. But the price and importantly the location swung it for myself and two friends going to see Manic Street Preachers at the o2, as we decided to travel there and back by the Thames Clipper boat, which departed from London Bridge, which is just a few stops away on the Northern Line. The hotel was just 5 mins from Old Street underground station, we passed a couple of supermarkets, cafes, pubs and a Subway on the way to the hotel. Not much else around, it’s mainly offices and apartments, but in the grand scheme of things the location of the hotel is in great, as it’s so centrally located on the underground network. We arrived after the 3pm check-in time, there was a small queue at the desk, tried to use the automatic check-in machines, but all three were out of service. Once served check-in was swift. We wanted to eat before heading to the concert, but the restaurant hadn’t started serving at that time, the reception staff, without any prompting from us, went off and kindly checked if the kitchen could do anything for us, they apologised as they couldn’t help us, which was no problem. So I checked that we were okay to dial in a pizza and they were fine with it. In fact, talking of the staff, he check-in staff, bar staff and security guards were all fantastically helpful and lovely, especially the security guards. We had booked a family room, which was at the back of the hotel. It had a double bed and a twin sofa bed, the bed was comfortable the sofa bed a bit too firm and not very comfortable at all. The room also had a bath and a shower en-suite, small flat screen TV, desk , chair, open wardrobe and tea and coffee facilities. There was no hairdryer, but reception lent us a powerful one for a strict 45 mins! Our room was basic, a little bit bare and drab, but to be fair, for the money and location it was perfectly adequate. Also, when I had been looking in to booking a hotel room, some of Travelodge’s rivals had a silly rule that more than two adults were not allowed to share a room, which did not suit us three young women who were spending a girlie weekend in London! So we were happy that we could be accommodated by Travelodge. After the gig, we returned to the hotel at about 1am and made use of the comfortable 24 hour bar and also had a bit of snacky bar food which we had no complaints over. We were pleasantly surprised by the noon check-out the next day, which was great as we were shattered. Check-out was as quick as check-in and the receptionist asked if out stay had been good. So, in summary, the location and price were good, the room basic, yet adequate, the communal facilities were great and the staff excellent. I would stay here again for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, huge and cheap rooms. Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: TEYWEY
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very near most points of interests in London. A 10 minute walk and you are in Liverpool Street Station which is the Central Line to Oxford CIrcus and trains to/from Stansted. It can be a longer commute from Heathrow and Gatwick, but if you are looking for rooms that are clean, big rooms, with a 24 hours bar and restaurant and infront of a bus stop, then this is the place. Tesco express is just 2 blocks, M & S is just around and corner and good restaurants within a 10 mile radius. What's more, you have your own bathroom instead of paying GBP 50 for a shared facilities. Rooms can accommodate up to 4 pax on the same price. Put your email in their maling list and you will get news on sales atleast 2 weeks before. The staff are good and helpful and lady at the bar was very friendly. I will definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for business in city of london”
Reviews.Author: anwo1980
Reviews.Content: I have stopped here on numerous occassions, ideal for anyone working in the city of london, staff friendly, food ok,rooms clean

Reviews.Title: “Room 216 over a strip club”
Reviews.Author: Kim H
Reviews.Content: I had a terrible night stay at London Central Moorgate. There was music blaring from somewhere until nearly 4am and being nearly 5 months pregnant I needed to get some sleep, which didn't happen. I was in room 216 and when I checked out I asked what the noise would have been and was informed the room was above a strip club. The receptionist was almost patronising in saying if I was not happy when I checked in I could have requested to be moved - the music was not playing at 3:30pm in the afternoon. I will NOT be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: si1972
Reviews.Content: Well having read the reviews on here I wasn't expecting a great stay, but I found the reception staff friendly, the lifts were swift, the room wasnt too noisy unless the window was open (Room 548.) The view from my room was of some of the city although I could look down into an office. I didnt eat at the hotel so cant comment on the food but the restaurant looked clean and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel with surprisingly good evening meals.”
Reviews.Author: alken
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean and convenient for City of London attractions. Bus stop immediately outside the door for city-bound buses and it's not much more than a 5 - 6 minute walk to Moorgate tube station. ("Tube" is English speak for 'Subway/Metro/Underground' for non-UK readers ! ) Old Street tube station is even closer. 30 - 35 minutes easy walking will take you to The Tower & Tower Bridge, The Monument, London Bridge, St Paul's etc. Staff were friendly, helpful and quick to remedy any problems. (Somehow we only had 1 bath towel between 2 of us but that was remedied immediately when we mentioned it at the front desk.) The rooms are best described as 'perfectly adequate' with no frills. Aside from the bed there is a TV and coffee/tea making facilities and storage space for your 'stuff' . . oh, and an en suite bath/shower room. We were more than a little surprised that we ate at the hotel's restaurant on each of the 3 evenings of our stay ~ the food was really good . . . at least of a much higher quality than we would have expected from a budget hotel. . . . and talking of a budget hotel -- we paid £108.00 for 3 nights B & B for 2 adults !!! Overall, we would certainly recommend this hotel, the only downside being that the cooked part of the breakfast reflected its 'budget hotel' origin, although there was an ample selection of fruit juices, cereals, coffee/tea, bread/toast, muffins, croisants and spreads. Also, it would have been very welcome if there had been a left luggage facility at the hotel as we arrived in London early morning and departed late evening and had to trudge around London all day (both days) with all our luggage.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, dont expect more”
Reviews.Author: bojangles
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on NYE 2011, booked upfront, in advance in Aug, £95 for a family room (exc Breakfast). Not bad for ctrl London on NYE! (Breakfast was £6.95 each and kids eat free, which we added). First off, location, well its easy enough to get to from either Moorgate or Old St tubes on the Northern Line. Its on the busy noisy City Road, so don’t expect peace and tranquillity, at any time 24/7! There are the usual coffee shops around the place, Pret, Nero etc, plus a Metro Sainsbury’s & Tesco within 5mins walk, and a nice looking café besides Old St tube (which sadly, was closed). On arrival at 2:25, as we had been travelling for 3hrs, and had young kids with us, we asked if we could check in (normal check-in time is 3pm) and was told that would be an extra £10, there is no flexibility with this, which peeved me! and was then told abruptly by the receptionist "i don’t make the rules" (zero customer service niceties). When we came back at 2:55 there was now along queue of people waiting to check in, and the foyer was busy; they have self service machines, so we tried this, only it didn’t recognise our booking! So then we waited in line and checked in after a phone call to the house keeper to check if the room was ready. We were in room 254. All TL rooms are basic, so you know in advance what you’re going to get, a bed, TV, bath-shower/WC. All fine & clean. The mattress of the bed was the softest I have ever tried, very uncomfortable, but the sofa bed for 2 kids was fine. The TV didn’t have a remote control, so we went back down to reception and asked for one which was brought up to our room. Most annoying were the noise from adjacent rooms, OK it was NYE so we expected partying, but the constant slamming of door, shouting & screaming from people running up and down the corridors and the loud music was rather testing, even mid-afternoon, early evening! We were out until abt 1:15am, and came back to note the hotel had “Security” staff in the foyer, and the bar open 24hrs. We got to sleep at 2-sih, only to be woken up between 4-5am, from returning revellers, no problem, we’d expected that and it soon came down, plus I knew we’d take our revenge when we were getting up at 9 for breakfast, and not trying to be quiet in our room!  So we eventually went down for breakfast at about 930, to be met by a queue into the restaurant/bar area, which was full of people, we ended up be sat on the sofa /coffee table area as there were no dining tables. What then followed can only be described as a food fight, you would be fortunate to get anything unless waiting in line, with people jostling and barging in front to get at whatever that could grab, not pretty, not relaxed not enjoyable, and food of poor quality and not enough staff to organize the place. Kids managed to get some insipid watery scrambled eggs sausage/beans and toast and we had breads/pastry and juices; it’s a budget hotel, you get what you pay for, don’t expect more. We’ll stay in TL’s again no doubts, but not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but remember it is a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: cafrinagain
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times. It is convenient (if you are working in the City) and cheap, and if you aren't feeling adventurous then the cafe downstairs is good too. The rooms can be noisy, with buses at the front and dustcarts at the back, so be aware of that and bring earplugs. The rooms themselves are clean and straightforward, and contrary to other reviewers I have always found the reception staff to be helpful and engaging. The local area appears at first sight to be a bit "dead" but do your homework before you arrive and you will find a lot of local pubs and restaurants tucked away in the backstreets.

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: Mountain300
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for one night (19 Nov 11) as I was attending function close by. Basic room no view but quiet. As others have mentioned, the pillows are way to thin. Check-in queues cab be really long, use the quick check in machines, ten times faster. Cannot comment on breakfast as it was cheaper to pick something up on the way to the station. Room rate of £95.95 (booked online) for one night is a rip off as are most things in London.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, especially in a sale”
Reviews.Author: Musselburgh_Traveler
Reviews.Content: We got an extremely low price for the room, £12, in an advance sale offer from Travelodge. For this price you really don't expect much! We liked this Travelodge. It's a bit of a walk from Old Street station (along City Road) but there are two different bus lines from King's Cross railway station which stop more or less outside of the hotel, and we found this more convenient for travelling to KX with luggage then negotiating the Tube. The room was clean and surprisingly large with a television, kettle/tea/coffee, hangers for clothes... and that's about it! A confusion about the number of people staying in the room (2 of us, though the reservation only was for 1) meant we received an entire set of extra bedding. I'm still not sure why, but it was handy as it meant we had twice the number of pillows and towels. The pillows were quite thin, so the extra set was a bonus. The view from the window was, well, other rooms and the roof of the restaurant. There was little to no noise from outside when the window was closed. The price is room only, and extras such as toiletries (other than a bar of soap), internet access, early check in/out and luggage storage after checkout, which are typically included with the room rate in most hotels, have to be paid for. However, this is made very clear when booking so I can't really see why anyone can then complain about it on this website. We didn't eat at the hotel, though it has a fairly large bar/restaurant area and the prices on the menu were very reasonable. The surrounding area has a few restaurants, Tesco, Sainsbury, several bus lines stop very close to the hotel, and it's about a 5 minute walk to Old Street underground station. Overall on future trips to London we will definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good For The Price”
Reviews.Author: littlemissscifi
Reviews.Content: The Travelodge on City Road is fairly good hotel. Its centrally located and close to the Moorgate Tube Station which makes it convinient to get around London and its surrounds. The room amenities are comfortable and not overly fancy, but the rooms are clean and welcoming. There is a restaurant and bar downstairs which offers a decent menu and the buffet breakfast was wonderful. There aren't many bars or resturants in the immediate area, so its a good amenity to have if you're arriving rather late. The only real issue I had with this hotel was the extreme slowness of the elevators. There is a bank of three, but they take forever to show up.

Reviews.Title: “Little above average”
Reviews.Author: Seb B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in room 545 last weekend with my girlfriend on Sat 17/12, check in was okay facilities in our room and around the hotel were all clean and working but staff were not always so helpful; I was aware that shampoo, toothpaste etc. wasn't provided in our rooms but there was none available at the hotel only at the Tesco's just down the road (Travelodge site states you can buy these from the lobby) so we had to wait until morning to buy these. Don't forget to bring these before you get to your hotel. My girlfriend also asked for a hair dryer and after repeating myself as the member of staff attempted to hand us an iron, we were told we could only borrow the hair dryer for 45 minutes so we ended up having just a quick shower with soap they gave us. We were on the 5th floor and expecting a half decent view but it was mostly derelict buildings i.e. with boarded up windows and roadworks all the way down City Road but not something the hotel can take the blame for really. I'm just being picky here - but despite this we had a good night's sleep and sound of traffic was very low but if you're not used to the sound of city life you may want some headphones to wear at night in case. We got hungry so went to grab some food at reception, they cook to order even if it's basic you can take it up to the room with you with affordable prices I think it was all night as well (just order at the bar). Breakfast was all you can eat too and well worth paying for, not a bad hotel to stay in what with a bar that serves all night although you need your room card for use of toilets and the bar past 11pm which is fairs. Would stay again if the price was cheaper, look around as you can do better than £62 even with breakfast which is what this cost - but would definitely pick this over hostels and most B&Bs as it's pretty central and I didn't have any major problems staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: mattdb07
Reviews.Content: We arrived early at the hotel, because of the pouring rain on 19th Dec. We arrived about 14:00. We were told that we couldn't check in until 15:00. We only wanted to drop our bag off and head straight out. For this privilege we were charged an extra £10. The room was ok. Small but enough. The bed was comfortable. Ok if you want to stay for the night. It was lucky the hotel was quiet, because it was noisy enough with the few guests that were there.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the odd night at the right price!”
Reviews.Author: GoodorBadSurrey
Reviews.Content: My office is not far from here and I needed a flexible booking which I could cancel on the day if required, so it worked well. Check in was ok, although all the auto machines were not working, there was no queue when I checked in, but one soon formed behind me and on the three occasions I passed through reception, there were people waiting. Not a massive issue, but if you have auto machines it's great if they work! Room was your standard Travelodge offering, shower only no bath. I was in a room which faced into a closed in area at the far end of the building and therefore traffic was not an issue, in fact it was pretty quiet for central London, but another guest was asking if he could be moved when I checked in because his room faced the main road and it was noisy, his request was rejected on the basis of they only have family rooms on that side of the buiilding. Things were fairly clean, no complaints. Room was a bit scruffy in places, but I was only using it as somewhere to sleep and spending very little time there, it did exactly what I needed. One thing which I have found in numerous Travelodges, is the loose toilet seat, they all seem to have the same design which obviously fails after a few years of use, unlike my review of the Windsor Travelodge however, at least this one was still attached to the toilet, if disconcertingly wobbly!!! I had hoped to stay there for a second night, but pre Christmas the demand for rooms on a Thursday was obviously high because they wanted £256, it's definitely not worth anything like that much even in London!! I paid £120 for the night I did stay, which I would say was fair.

Reviews.Title: “The check-in let this ace down big time”
Reviews.Author: PaulSurrey1
Reviews.Content: I understand check in was at 15.00 or later, but I turned up at 14.52 and was told to go sit and wait in the corner until 15.00. There were maybe a dozen other people there waiting. I asked why I couldn't check in now and was informed I wasn't allowed until 15.00. I asked if it was because the room wasn't ready, but she said yes the room is ready but the computer won't let me do it until after 15.00 so just wait. At this point her manager turned up and I asked her if she could help. She looked embarrassed and asked the lady to do it but she said no cos other people were waiting also. So I asked if she could help and she did. Minutes later i was checked in (don't think the others were happy mind). There was no bedding for the sofa bed in the room and when I asked for some I was told to collect it later as they were busy. Once again, not good customer service. Toilet seat wasn't cleaned properly. If you're on the city road side of the hotel, it's very noisy with the morning traffic. Location is good for business but don't pick this if you're a tourist. There's nothing here except banks and pubs. Go to the west end.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel but in central financial area”
Reviews.Author: travellertopoland2
Reviews.Content: Moorgate is the nearest Tube station (rather than Old Street) and the hotel is about 200m north, and sits on a fork in the road. It looks to be a conversion of a former bank or similar office structure. It is pretty impersonal and we spoke to no staff. We had prepaid and on arrival inserted my credit card into a machine which released a receipt and a plastic key card. As we arrived before 15.00 but after 12.00 we opted to pay an extra £10.00 for immediate access. Again done through the machine. The card was needed to open a corridor door accessing the lifts. We had room 201. This was a decent size but clinical and lacking in decoration. But it had the essentials of a bed, desk and chairs. The bed was ok. The bathroom had a walkin shower comprising a rose and a shower curtain round it. There was a washbasin and toilet. All clean but rather stark. We did not have any meals. We left, having prepaid and again without needing to speak to anyone. In summary, the hotel is well placed but is basic and lacks frills. There are few staff and this will be a key reason for the low price - £71 + £10 early arrival charge.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, tidy, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: BritLithcouple
Reviews.Content: A much better bet that Travelodge Aldgate east, nowhere near as noisy. All you would expect from a Travelodge, clean, tidy, good size room, well maintained, very convenient location, friendly staff. About 15 mins on foot to City of London and 5 mins in a Taxi if traffic is not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: joyous1963
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Sun 27th Nov,booked as an overnight stay for shopping and sightseeing trip with 3 work colleagues.Check in was smooth,rooms were good and clean.Only 5 mins walk from Old Street tube station.Great location, very central and for £29 a night what's to complain about ???????????? Not noisy, and had many supermarkets and eateries close by, plus they do food 24/7, or so it said. Very enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Horrid place”
Reviews.Author: swissinfo
Reviews.Content: I was booked in to this rubbish hotel by my company due to its close access: 1. I found the state of the hotel to be in very poor in decor, smelly, 2. Open areas for eating uncleaned surfaces in breakfast and dining areas, the staff walking around with a old rag to clean tables and without even using any type of liquid cleaning product sprayed on the tables, 2. The food was terrible, at breakfast eggs looked like something that had been sitting around for days the bread toasting machines made the bread black with no chance adjusting the toasting machine since someone had take the control knobs off the machine, sausages looked like they had never been turned in the cooking dish of the oven so they were half done, bacon has no resemblance to anything that ever looks like bacon rashers, 3. The bedroom room heater did not work freezing cold 5. Bathroom looked very shabby and there looked like some sort black stuff around the base of the shower tray. 4. The hall ways did look clean, on several occasions I saw even on the floor in public areas or plates and glasses just left out in the corridors for hours on end. Never again will I let my company book this place again, no matter how desperately we will need a room, I was tempted to just sleep in my hire car!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean, great value and good location”
Reviews.Author: DerbyLass18
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night as attended a venue close by. A very busy travelodge however it was extremely quiet in the room which was unexpected. The breakfast was delicious. My only complaint would be that we booked a twin and got a double, so we asked for another duvet and also an extra towel (2 booked into the room, yet only one set of towels!). We were assured they would be in our room later on. After shopping went back to the room and no towels or extra duvet! My other gripe would be the £10 early check in charge. The room was ready so why charge??? We couldn't store our bags either! So whichever way they have got you!

Reviews.Title: “25 POUNDS A NIGHT!”
Reviews.Author: josh47003
Reviews.Content: 10 minutes walk from Liverpool Street Station, we stayed here to rest for a few hours before getting the train to Stansted. Bed was awful but the room was quiet and warm, huge bar and good vending machines. Amazing value at just 25GBP online. Would recommend it, but do not expect anything more than somewhere convenient and cheap to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice atmosphere, Good location”
Reviews.Author: XTheGeekFreakX
Reviews.Content: Customer Service Some of the staff were nice but slightly slow and not quite aware of what was going on, and if I'm honest, could barely speak English. Seemed like they have been stuck in the job and not properly trained. The barman was lovely and the kitchen staff were too. Rooms Our room was small for a family room and the double bed was very soft. Although I didn't find this to be a problem, the person I was sharing with found it to be very uncomfortable. The room itself was clean, but the bathroom was not. Hair left around and barely any toilet roll, also dirty sink. No towels left or bed sheets and we had to ask twice for this to be done, and on the second night, having to collect towels AGAIN ourself from reception. Food & Drink Breakfast was nice, but could do with a bit more variety on the hot food side. Maybe a bit pricey for adults alone, and is probably cheaper and more satisfying finding a Wetherspoons and eating there. But for a family of 4 with kids eating free, its the same price and easier so worth it. Facilities Location Fantastic location, easy to get to everything, two tube stations near by and a bus stop outside the door. Tesco express two doors down. No complaints at all! Overall, we will definitely go again as its a good location, and I guess it's just bad luck with the rooms really. Worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “return trip, good value, but.....”
Reviews.Author: ka058
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Travelodge before and like before price was the driving force behind booking. Paid average £60 per night for two nights of a 4 night trip. We stayed at Travelodge Royal Scot first two nights because room cost more than double for a wed/thurs. We would choose to return to City Road ahead of Royal Scot if prices were similar for a few reasons. 1. The property is modern and in better repair 2. Wiifii is infinitley better As mentioned in our previous review the location is 5 minutes from Moorgate subway and even within walking distance of Thames. I would return to this hotel for a third visit. But..... We arrived 90 minutes before the official 3pm check in. Travelodge wanted £10 to check in early to our room, suggesting it was ready anyway. We declined and sat in the cafe using the free wifi. It seemed at least another 10 guests had this issue at same time. If the rooms are ready then it would be nice to think customer service comes before profiteering.

Reviews.Title: “Good value at £25”
Reviews.Author: JofromWales
Reviews.Content: I sometimes stay here if I can get a room for £25, works out cheaper than a taxi that way. Room is clean, bed comfy and has the usual tv, tea & coffee etc. For £25 in Central London you cannot really fault it. My room was quiet, faced an inner courtyard so no outside road noise. Location is good. Staff can get a bit grumpy but nothing worth mentioning. Bar and Restaurant downstairs so you can get a drink or snack and take it to your room. Would I stay here again??? Yes for £25, no for full price which is about £100

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: docgautham
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally centrally located with a bus stop just outside with frequent buses to all places frequently visited by tourists to London. There are 2 underground train stations conveniently located down the road in opposite directions. The room was extremely comfortable and spacious enough for my wife, and 2 daughters aged 25 and 15 with very comfortable mattresses on the beds. . All conveniences were available in the room including hair dryer, iron, wi-fi, TV, coffee and tea The hotel is very safe and secure. The staff were very courteous and the check in very quick. The breakfast was sumptuous but the menu was fixed through the week. The hotel is extreme value for money. Breakfast is free for children, and milk is available free of charge for children at any time. There are a few eateries with varied cuisine just next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: Nasalhair
Reviews.Content: Sadly I'm often sent here when working in London as my company has an office directly behind the hotel, but convenience definitely doesn't mean quality. If you arrive late at night (after 11PM) you have to ring a night bell and be buzzed in by the receptionist, where you are handed your key card and a voucher you need to present each morning in order to qualify for your breakfast. I've yet to lose this voucher but often wonder what would happen if I did. Once you find your room in the bizarre layout - a strange triangular shape - it is hardly welcoming, with its stark, white walls, white roller blind, white bedding... It's like being snow-blind. There are absolutely no facilities and the hotel is very, very noisy indeed, with City Road being a main road and a bus route, so if you manage to sleep you're doing better than I did. Take ear plugs, or buy some from Boots down the road - you'll need them. Breakfast is a buffet. On my last visit I was accosted by an angry man as I fetched myself some cereal, demanding baked beans as the vessel on the counter was empty. I had to explain that just because I was wearing a suit it didn't make me an employee, and in fact if he looked around all of the employees were wearing Travelodge-branded polo shirts. There's a decent selection of stuff, and the usual (these days) conveyor-belt toaster, where somebody seems to set fire to a croissant each morning despite the signs telling them not to, but the breakfast room itself is a huge, unwelcoming space, always crowded and under-staffed. In terms of transport Old Street station is a few minutes stroll up City Road, and the hotel is located on a bus route. The City is 20-30 minutes walk and is flat, but very busy. If you're visiting London for one night then by all means stay here if it is handy, but it is often massively overpriced for what little you get, and is soul destroying if you find yourself stuck there for a week.

Reviews.Title: “not a very nice hotel to stay in.”
Reviews.Author: stevej06
Reviews.Content: pillows here are wafer thin,asked for 2 extra to be taken to room while i was out.they never showed so had to get some from reception at midnight.evening meal was hopeless,well over cooked salmon and strangely coloured salad leaves!!!breakfast ok though.lots of noise from street facing rooms,not a good nights kip!sadly,i think travelodge have fallen down the order in budget hotels,premier inn and travel inn are by far better.

Reviews.Title: “No pillow talk here...”
Reviews.Author: altwishes
Reviews.Content: As with other reviews the pillows are tiny and uncomfortable...silly mistake really as everything else was acceptable for the price. Rooms basic and clean, no hairdryer girls!!! Towels for a double room were one small and one even smaller. Our front road facing room was noisy with early morning traffic. Breakfast was plentiful, buffet style. There is a supermarket very close by so good for snacks etc. City Road is handy for buses, tube and all the sightseeing. Any nearer to the city centre and it would not be as reasonably priced. Don't expect too much and you won't be dissappointed. I would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - could do better!”
Reviews.Author: WindermereBoys
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Travelodge on a number of occasions and I would rate it as one of the best in the chain. But I do think Premier inns have upped their game as a good value budget hotel and the Travelodge brand is falling behind. The rooms are clean and comfortable and probably more suited to business travellers rather than leisure as there are not many restaurants open nearby. I prefer the rooms at the rear of the hotel but as with many hotels in London a pair of ear plugs is often needed to guarantee a good night's sleep. On my last trip I was woken by a refuse vehicle at 6am. I guess you get what you pay for and I have often stayed here for less than £20 courtesy of the Travelodge sales promotions - difficult to complain at those prices!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: kate186470
Reviews.Content: Simple hotel, good location. You get what you pay for. Only negative was no hair drier supplied!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not so cheerful.”
Reviews.Author: GuessWhoToo
Reviews.Content: For what we required - a place for a family of 4 to sleep for 5 nights whilst sightseeing - this hotel suited our needs. Clean room with own bathroom. BUT...as mentioned in other reviews pillows were wafer thin and although asking for 4 extra pillows only received 2. We were on a street facing first floor room and the noise from the street below resulted in nights of unsettled sleep. On checking the window....even when closed tight daylight could be seen through the frame so sound easily entered the room. Breakfast was basic and the buffet style meant you could fill up for the day...however...the quality of the food wasn't great and the bacon nbecame cold very quickly.

Reviews.Title: “You need to be a heavy sleeper”
Reviews.Author: M00sej00se
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night prior to a nearby business meeting. The room I was given overlooked City Road which is a busy arterial route in to London and has quite a few pubs and restaurants. The noise from the street was very loud indeed, shutting the window made little difference as there is no soundproofing which I find incredible for a modern hotel situated in such a busy and noisy area. At just after 1am I'd had enough and went to ask reception if they had another room, one was found for me. I went in and although the room appeared to have been cleaned/bed made etc there was a fetid stench of body and foot odour throughout the room, so bad that it was almost overpowering! As it was so late I couldnt be bothered to complain again and just tried to make the best of it, I ended up getting about two hours sleep which did not equip me at all well for my meeting the following day. This room was also still very noisy indeed. I did complain in the morning to the manager who appeared at first to be quite dismissive,however when I took her name, Kinga and said that I would be submitting an internet review she chased after me from reception as I went back to the lifts to go back to my smelly room to get my bags. She was then very much more attentive and offered me a voucher for half of the price of my stay for another travelodge within the next year. She didnt seem to realise that on this showing there was no way I would ever stay at a Travelodge again!

Reviews.Title: “A nice Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: CEWEngland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on business recently. A 5 minute walk from the tube, this is a relatively new, big Travelodge with a large (and very efficient) restaurant/breakfast room. I checked in using the 'Quick Check In' machine with no problem. My room was standard 'new' Travelodge - clean, modern and with basic facilities. My room was looking over the back of the hotel and I heard no noise during the night at all. My one small 'gripe' would be that I was on a high floor, and the lifts seemed to take forever to go up or down. I ended up walking back up after breakfast as I got tired of waiting. Aside from that, I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, better than expected”
Reviews.Author: BRandJM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the City Road Travelodge on a Sunday night. The reception staff were courteous and friendly, dealing with any requests promptly. The room was bigger than some Travelodges I have stayed in previously, very clean but souless (as expected really). I wish it was not so white - bed linen, walls, blinds all white with no colour anywhere. The location was convenient, between Morgate and Old Street stations. I was not aware of any traffic noise. I was woken by delivery vans at 6am - the noise did not last for long and I went back to sleep. I think it would be unreasonable to complain about noise when you are staying in the city centre, as others have done. I have stayed in several London Travelodges and this was the best one.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic hotel. Poor facilities & lack of customer care.”
Reviews.Author: AJWF
Reviews.Content: We were initially given one towel between two of us & a half used toilet roll (no spare rolls). Also there are no hairdryers in the rooms. If u want a hairdryer u must get it from reception but be aware that you are only allowed it for 45 mins! I made the mistake of washing my hair only to find there were no hairdryers available. The staff were very unhelpful & told me all I could do is come back later when one might be available but they couldn't tell me when. I had to go out with wet hair in cold windy London which wasn't pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money stay”
Reviews.Author: huwjones792
Reviews.Content: We used the Travelodge in City Road during Half Term School Holidays 24-26 Oct 2011. Must say that we were happy with our family room, clean, quiet (a little apprehensive because of reviews) and not too hot. Beds a little uncomfortable, but everyone slept quite well. We had booked the £9.95 evening meal (2 course) which included wine/larger/soft drinks which was a very good deal. Food was quite good but service lacked co-ordination. Breakfast was very good but again not enough staff on hand to handle the very busy time 8.30am onwards - everything was running out and took a little time to get more. We used the Oyster Card for travelling from Moorgate Underground which was very convenient and we also used the No 76 to the city from outside the Travelodge. There is a cinema a few miles up the road and we hired a taxi to get there (Vue) for about £6.00 (family of 4). We paid about £74.00 per night which is excellent as location is convenient for most areas. It is only 3 stops from Euston. We hired the Boris Bikes from Hyde Park (you can get them from all over London) and we cycled for about 90 mins which cost us £1.00 per person! We cycled in Hyde Park only, but you can go all over London on them. Put your credit card in and you pay £1.00 for access (24 hours) and you then get billed on your credit card for the amount of time used. You return the bike to any Boris Bike stop and make sure that the green light comes on as you push it into the stand and they bill you for the time used. Excellent. We would recommend the Travelodge as a good location, clean with good food, but service needs a little attention - will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Mohawk1946
Reviews.Content: This is a really good hotel for sightseeing in London. However, I found the staff surly and not very helpful. The rooms were fairly clean. The breakfast in the joining restaurant was good and well worth the £7.50

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: LesleyDavies34
Reviews.Content: 4 females needing a cheap hotel for a night decided we would pay half the price of the Covent garden travelodge. Taxi to her majesty's theatre cost £15 each way so we saved a big chunk of money & it was around 15 minutes away. Great pub just over the road & reasonably priced with nice lunches. Check in not till 3pm. The room was bog standard; strange smell we think was from the bathroom under the shower as the shower tray over flowed. The bathroom floor is in need of a bleach but other than that it was clean. Clean bedding but the bed was far too soft. Not enough pillows either. Decent enough pizza in the restaurant for a late snack & the bar is 24 hour. Wasn't too busy for a Saturday night. Outside noise wasn't a problem from 4th floor and most internal noise died off around midnight. However! At around 3:50am the night manager? And security decided to evict a guest from a room near to ours for smoking. With much protest from the guest(s) & around a 40 minute argument in the corridor with every word heard by us. Eventually the guests were given 10 minutes to pack. In the meantime: whomever was going to kick them out decided to have a full blown conversation right outside our door. Like they couldn't have moved around to the lifts or something! Then came the eviction itself! With much door knocking, more dispute & doors banging; the noise eventually ended at around 5am. Being wide awake at this point there wasn't much hope of having a decent sleep. Complained about it at check out to be told it's not the first time someone has complained about noise & that our comments would be passed to the manager who Would call me with an explanation - still waiting for that call. If that had been Premier Inn with good night guarantee then we would have been refunded! Overall it's cheap & depends what you need from a bed for the night. If it's cheap you're after then this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: deathsblackdove
Reviews.Content: Just another travelodge, clean basic and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: UkPeteD
Reviews.Content: Plus side - Spacious clean room - Free Wifi in Bar - Places to eat in hotel - Tesco and Sainsbury just next to hotel - 5-10 mins walk 2 tube Could be better' - Free Wifi in room - toiletries

Reviews.Title: “Remember you're just a profit generation unit”
Reviews.Author: Steve_mad
Reviews.Content: Value for money, quality and London hotel are not three concepts that seem to come together often and this hotel is no exception. Travelodge are not my preferred budget hotel option and this one is fairly typical. As a new build the rooms are in good condition and clean, which has not been my experience elsewhere in this company. They have become the masters at chargeable extras, a charge to get into the room early, a charge for breakfast, internet access etc etc. This is central London, you can get breakfast cheaper within 100m. The room was too warm and the window restricted for "safety". The staff were friendly and helpful but my main complaint is the lack of anywhere to store Luggage. An inconvenience in most paces but in Central London a nightmare. I'll be back if I can find nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: rachelh3826
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a family room for 3 nights in August 2011, there were 2 adults and a child in the room. Hotel was extremely hot and the room was unbearable with the heat as no air con in rooms. Our room was at the back of the hotel and was very very noisy, there were lorries late into the night and early in the morning (6am of 3 mornings we were there) so made it hard to sleep. Staff could barely speak english in reception or restaurant. Breakfast was very busy and hard to get a table, when we did get a table they were always running out of things, glasses, bread, forks, bacon...to name a few. On the plus side it was only a 3-4 minute walk from tube station and there was a tesco express next door.

Reviews.Title: “Will not return”
Reviews.Author: mervalino
Reviews.Content: As others have mentioned, it is uncomfortably hot in the lifts and corridors, the floors of which did not look like they had seen a vacuum cleaner recently. You cannot turn off the air con in your room so there is a constant noise. Also it is too loud if you open the window even though my room was on the 5th floor and facing the back. My bed was far too soft, more like a 10yr old trampoline. Partly my fault but when my phone ran out of credit, I had no way to contact the outside world, (or to continue moaning to my poor boyfriend at home about my room) I don't think a phone is too much to ask for in even a basic hotel. Other Travelodges I've stayed in at least had a phone. This would have been very useful to call reception instead of having to get dressed and go downstairs to request a replacement duvet as the huge brownish yellow stain on mine was not conducive to sleep. I could only imagine what the stain was. The replacement duvet was also a single...for my double bed. At least the receptionist was ok, and I guess at least this duvet was clean. I will be having words with whichever receptionist at my work booked this one. I point blank refuse to return.

Reviews.Title: “1ST CLASS FOR THE MONEY I PAID”
Reviews.Author: pag63
Reviews.Content: I stayed over the weekend 23-25 September, I arrived before 3pm so had to wait to check in. However the staff were brilliant, Clive the South African Manager is an absolute gentleman and I was very impressed with him. The reception staff were also super efficient and polite - no complaints so far. My room was on the first floor, clean tidy and with everything I needed. Underground links are good with 3 tube stations within easy walk (for a reasonably unfit 47 year old man) bus stops right outside the front door (where all the smokers sit!!). Bar closes 10mins after the last customer leaves - which is excellent, as I met a bunch of Welsh tattoo artists who were charming, nice and very funny people and I am privilidged to have met them. All in all a super cheap hotel - which is not the Rtiz, but then it does not pretend to be - unlike some other hotels i have stayed at. SO IF YOU WANT A CHEAP HOTEL THAT OFFERS GOOD CLEAN ACCOMODATION, GOOD STAFF AND IS VERY WELL LOCATED IN LONDON - YOU WILL NEED TO GO A LONG WAY TO BEAT THIS FOR £29 PER NIGHT. Thanks Clive.

Reviews.Title: “No problems any time”
Reviews.Author: xvicx
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel 3 times now and it is great value for money. We have paid between 15-70 per night and I haven't found better for the same price in London. The location is great 2 min walk to old street tube station very quick to get to sights and shops. There is a Starbucks, telco around the hotel to which is handy. Rooms are a good size and found the rooms and bathroom very clean, basic but that's all I'm looking for for the price and amount of time I'm spending in my room. We had breakfast in the hotel which is buffet and not bad but a little expensive. Staff were pleasant and happy to give us more pillows. We would stay here again for less than £100.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: TimelordUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my partner, booked in advance during a sale and got the room for £15 so clearly I thought it was excellent value for money. After reading the reviews I was worried about this hotel, however I was very pleased. The reception area was the biggest and brightest I'd seen, and I've stayed in a few of these Travelodges, they even had complimentary iced water in glasses. The receptionist was very polite and welcoming. Our room was on the fourth floor. I was very pleased to find we had been given a double room with shower and a bath. The room was large with a double bed settee under the window which was great to lounge on. The actual bed was very comfortable too. We had the buffet breakfast in the morning, excellent value, and a very spacious modern dining area. Lots of choices of food. The waitress who seated us was very pleasant as well. The only negative thing I can say, and I'd have to be forced at gun point to think of anything, is that the hotel was quite warm, especially in corridors by the lift, but again, how much time do you actually spend there? The traffic outside was quite noisey with the window open, but not too bad in the early hours while you are sleeping obviously. Also the location isn't that good because there's not much going on in the immediate area, but its only 5 mins walk to Old St tube, or you could walk to town as I did in The evening back to the hotel, took me half an hour. You'll need the exercise to burn off that breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic accommodation - which can be hard to find in london”
Reviews.Author: columbiaSydney
Reviews.Content: I've noticed the prices for this hotel vary considerably, I guess depending on availability. The rooms are clean but basic and normally better value than most similarly rated hotels. The hotel doesn't have a store room for luggage. The nearest available storage facilities are at Liverpool station where storage costs $$.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: n0028094
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff tried hard but just didn't know how to do; from the basics for checking in, or running a bar and restaurant. The rooms are bare with nothing on the walls and the cover inside out and barely covering the duvet, and put on the bed with the duvet sticking out near your head. The mattress was so soft and old you roll into the centre and can't get out. Food was ok for a snack but if there's an option to eat somewhere else, do so. Overall a depressing stay, but as a one night stay tolerable

Reviews.Title: “Worst travelodge experience, ever.”
Reviews.Author: tony u
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several Travelodge's; and will continue to do so, BUT, my recent stay at City Road, London was TERRIBLE. Firstly, the reception staff failed to acknowledge we had 2 nights booked, not one (we booked two separate one night stays) - until I brought donw my BBC Laptop, and the supervisor appeared. Secondly, our second night was spoilt by constant loud music and shouting/screaming from outside way past 2am. Thirdly, and most importantly; after returning home, my partner had stomach pains, sickness and diahorrea. We brought back some of the milk cartons from the room, and upon inspection we discovered they were dated May 2011 - 4 months out of date - so BEWARE, dont touch the milk in the room. Of course we have complained, and are awaiting their response.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, and very noisy.”
Reviews.Author: LH1988
Reviews.Content: We stayed here thinking it was a conveniently placed, budget hotel. It had a clean bed, and a clean bathroom and that's it. It was extremely hot inside the hotel, and very noisy. Yes, our room was above the delivery entrance but this left us unable to open our window when it became too hot. The hotel is also near various bars and nightclubs, which also adds to the noise. Furthermore, the staff were incredibly unhelpful when we were asking for extra items for our room which should have been provided in the first place. We waited 10 minutes at the reception desk before someone came to see us, even after we'd called them. Once someone came out we were met with a sigh. This was at 8pm. During our second day someone knocked on our door 5 times to ask us to check out because we weren't booked in. This was done in a very rude manner, and the first time they knocked they claimed they were "checking the windows". So honesty is also not this hotels strongest point. Check-in was a slow process due to the systems being down, which led to queues of people on the street outside until 5pm each day. I would definitely not stay here again - I would rather pay a few pounds extra to have ALL amenities in the room when I arrive, and for pleasant staff members. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: KAZBarnsley
Reviews.Content: stayed here 3/9/11. Rooms are small but you ony sleep there. Staff really friendly excellant value for money. Large bar/resteraunt. Food lovely. All in all great hotel. Really clean and in a great location

Reviews.Title: “not the same as the 1st time we stayed”
Reviews.Author: sezzswain84
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights this week and was dissapointed, we have stayed here before and didnt have a problem however this time the service was poor.First of all we hardly got any sleep the 1st night as the room was boiling and with the window open the drop down blind rattled in the wind and also the pillows were like rocks! When i asked for a spare pillow at reception the response was there is 'a' spare in the room, i said yes but there is 2 of us, she walked off and handed me a pillow without saying anything (rude). The 2nd day we returned from out day out and had only been left 1 set of towels,again there was 2 of us, and also for the duration of the stay no bathmat, not good when i am 5 months pregnant and the floor is slippery. Again we asked if they had anymore pillows as the ones in our room were so flat and hard! we were told they have no spares!(what kind of hotel has no spare pillows) again boiling at night! Again on the 3rd day only 1 set of towels left again, when my husband went to ask for another set for the 2nd day in a row he got no response or apology and was just handed them. The bar staff were fairly polite but seemed to take forever to understand what you were ordering and the menu was very basic but overall the food wasnt bad. Just generally rception need to work on there customer service skills and maybe some aircon wouldnt go amiss considering its a central london hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Paula1546
Reviews.Content: Always stay here when in London 6th floor overlooking City Road - clean, comfortable & walking distance to New Change shopping centre, St , Museum of London etc; M & S, Tesco nearby. Restaurant excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Just the job...”
Reviews.Author: boleyuk
Reviews.Content: Having read some bad reviews, it was not without trepidation we arrived for a 4 night stay, me, wife, 13 and 10 yrs children staying in family room. Firstly some reviews mention rude staff. I did not find this at all, all staff encountered, reception, cleaning and restaurant were all very polite and courteous. Our room was on the back and overall, was quiet considering a stay in central London, but a couple of tmes we were awoken by noise, cause it was so hot in the room the window had to be left open..The room was very basic, but clean, although upon arrival it wasnt set up with pillows, quilts and towels sufficient nfor a family stay, but onyl had to ask at reception and matter was resolved. You are allowed a hairdryer / iron for for a short set period. room was fresh, carpets clean,and mattresses perfectly fine. Restaurant was good, great selection of food,cereals,drinks, and we did not have to wait once, considering we arrived each morning at its busiest time. We used the evening restaurant a couple of times for pizza in the room. These were freshly cooked, and well priced. Overall a no frills, comfortable stress free experience, which proved very good value for money for me. Would I recommend? Yes but only if you are not expecting anything more than basic needs, but all done in clean rooms, with good food available, by staff with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to get your head down”
Reviews.Author: cat_wigan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over bank holiday weekend to watch a rugby match at Wembley. The hotel was in a great location with two tube stations really close by and third about a 10 min walk. Despite warnings on the website about noise, our room was very quiet. The room was very basic with just a bed, shower and toilet. We booked for two people but our room was obviously a family room with the extra bed taken out, which made the room really large and a bit bare and echoey! However, as is usual for most city breaks we were barely in the room and when we were we just slept! This is a good hotel as it is central and well located. The bar is 24 hours and food is served quite late- i didnt try the food but the other couple we were with ate in both nights and said the food was not great but bearable. One night we came back and went to the bar/ restaurant area for a quick night cap and the bar area was a right mess! Food left out! Food on the floors and tables. Didnt try the breakfast but there is a Wheatherspoons 2min walk away and we ate breakfast there :o) All in all basic hotel but great for just using as a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a stay in London.”
Reviews.Author: RowlandAML
Reviews.Content: Travelodge rarely let's you down . You know what to expect before you get there. Clean room , with a good shower , comfy bed if a bit soft. Only a short walk to Moorgate tube station. This was our first stay in a Travelodge in London. I would definately choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, Travelodge City Road does not disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: Pilar1978
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week-long stay at the Travelodge City Road London. My husband and I had previously stayed here on a trip to London 4 years ago, and found that the hotel has happily not changed! The hotel has a good location, within an easy walk of Old Street and Moorgate tube stations; Bank station, with more route options, is also a quick walk down the street.
