Our room was basic, but had everything we needed - comfy bed and ensuite bath. Rooms are of a pretty good size here, and have cubbies and hangers if you require such. Flat screen TV was nice, though we were mostly just in the room to sleep! They will only give you one bath towel at a time, so be sure to ask for extra at the front desk. You'll also need to request the use of a hair dryer (or iron) if you don't bring your own; these are lent out in 30 minute increments. Our room (650) faced the intersection of Tabernacle and Worship streets - we didn't find street noise a problem, and left the window open perpetually. The hallways are hot, as others have indicated, and there is no a/c in the room, but with cool evenings the ventilation from the window alone was fine. Check in was speedy (we were permitted early check in, a great relief after an overnight trans-Atlantic flight) and desk staff were courteous. Lots of food options, from pubs to Tesco/Marks and Spencer/EAT/Starbucks on the street. I would definitely recommend this hotel to other travelers looking for basic, clean and comfortable accommodations in London.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Hakluyt
Reviews.Content: We (myself, husband and 20 year old daughter) stayed for one night, and had a spacious and clean room, with a double bed and a fold-out sofa bed. We were pleased that we could open the window as the weather was warm, but had to close it at night as the location was quite noisy. Speaking of which, from the point of view of convenience it is a super location, just a few steps from Old Street Station and Liverpool Street Station. I have paid much more for smaller rooms in less convenient locations in London. I would recommend it: you really can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: “It's basic, simple and a great travelodge.”
Reviews.Author: lenny9
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in Aug 19/20/21, after reading previous reviews i was beginning to dread going, but upon arrival i found if very different. Reception was fine, nice polite reception staff welcomed us with the offer of a ice cold drink. And gave us our room card, and pointed us in the direction of the lift, and this is then where the heat that people mention hit us, it is very hot in the areas where you are waiting for the lifts, and slightly warm in the corridors. All 3 lifts were a bit slow, but worked fine for the duration of our stay. Our room was 443 and was not faceing the main road, but the side road. Room was large, with a bed, chair, wardrobe, flat screen television. Room 443 is a very big room, and a very clean room, bedding was clean and fine, we only had 1 pillow each, on the way out i asked for extra pillows and a extra sheet, as i didn't want to sleep under the duvet, when we returned later on, they had been provided and was on the bed. We also had 2 large white fluffy bath towels and 2 small ones along with a bath mat, at the side of the bath, bathroom was very clean and tidy, 2 plastic cups and 1 small bar of soap was in as well. The weather when we was there that weekend was very hot, especially the sunday night, but we didn't find the room that hot we slept on the duvet, and had the sheet over us, we left the window open, and slept well on the comfortable bed. And we didn't find the room over hot. We heard no noise during the night, and none on the saturday/sunday morning, but on the monday morning, there was quite a few lorries and deliveries in this street, but then again you are in a city and we did expect this. Our towels were changed each day and housekeeping was fine. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel, as we was up and out early, but on sunday night we came back and went the bar and ordered 2 drinks, we sat in the restaurant to drink these. Prices were not to bad for a hotel. Check out was at 12, we came down handed our key card in, and was asked how was our stay, and hoped we had a nice journey home.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but certainly not cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: Henry1808
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend, check in was smooth enough, got into our room and it was bigger than I expected so was quite impressed. The I walked into the bathroom, and it clearly had not been cleaned, there were dirty towels in the room and also no toilet paper. I read that we would not get any toiletrees but didn't expect to not have toilet paper!! We went to complain about the state of the room and the attitude of the staff was disgusting. We also requested for 2 extra pillows and was told to ask when we returned as we were on our way out, when we got back that evening we were told all the extra pillows had gone, I explained that we requested it earlier and as you can guess they didn't keep us any. If you are going to stay here, make sure you bring your own hair dryer as you can borrow one from reception (if they have any left, didn't when I asked for one) and you can only use it for 30min! I know this was cheap and you pay for what you get, but I didn't expect to have such bad service!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, clean, one of the better travelodges!”
Reviews.Author: Blondie2405
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my partner for two nights last week. Compared to other travelodges (we have stayed in Liverpool, and Edinburgh) this one was more modern and a lot cleaner. We had a lovely view as you can tell from the pictures. The only slight problems we had were, firstly we tried to check in using the self service machine but it was out of order, secondly the receptionist that dealt with us spoke in a very quiet mumbly voice, thirdly only one lift out of three was working, and finally fourthly we only had three pillows in our room. When we asked for a fourth we were told that they weren't giving them out because there wasn't enough??? Apart from these very minor problems, we enjoyed our stay here, it was cheap to stay, £32 1st night £52 2nd night. It is located between two tube stations, Old Street and Moorgate and there is a Tesco and Sainburys nearby, and a Subway opposite that did a lovely breakfast! We will definately use again!

Reviews.Title: “Clive the manager is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: P.Knight
Reviews.Content: Once again the management at the Travelodge City road were amazing....unlike the unhelpful manager Joanne Walker at the Travelodge Halifax, the staff in London City Road always go the extra mile for their guests. Examples include: earlier check-in, providing a jug of water at reception; just what you need after a long hot trip on the underground. Clive also looked after a bag for me, which although not strictly company policy, showed compassion and reflected well on the Travelodge. I can't speak highly enough for all the staff at the Travelodge City Road....senior management at Travelodge should learn from this hotel and roll their ideas out. Hope they are reading this! Well done guys....we'll be back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “WARM WELCOME”
Reviews.Author: Neptune24
Reviews.Content: Travelodges vary a little from place to place but this was outstanding. The difference being the staff who were welcoming and helpful - rare to find in London. In addition a small gesture but very welcome was a jug of ice cold water at the check-in desk. Much appreciated when arriving on a muggy day. I also arrived before the 3pm check-in and was able to get to my room early too as it was ready. The staff and management here deserve credit for their helpfulness and efficiency.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful - will not stay at a Travelodge again”
Reviews.Author: jgnichols910
Reviews.Content: This was a very unpleasant culture shockj. Very hot. Only 1 lift working. Room clean enough but bed uncomfortable with very thin pillows. Only 1 towel and a bathmat (or perhaps it was 2 towels and no bathmat!). Bar/restaurant utilitarian. Got about 2 hours sleep because of noise (and I can cope with traffic noise as I live in a city centre!) Lobby crowded, chaotic and smelly. Didn't bother with breakfast. Generally like a youth hostel. I suppose you get what you pay for - never again!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel for a central London stay.”
Reviews.Author: Lostyeti73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights as a short getaway with the wife. The hotel is located close to a tube station and is quiet at night as it is surrounded mostly by office blocks. The room was a little small but clean and adequate equipped with a double bed, shower coffee making facilities and TV. Check in was impersonal as you checked in via an automated system that issued you a key card and room number. There is a restaurant and bar on site with reasonable prices when you consider the locality we had breakfast and one evening meal at the hotel the breakfast was a full English and of reasonable quality however the evening meal left a bit to be desired it was obviously a pre-prepared meal heated in a oven but the service was good. If you think you will be eating at the hotel pre book meal packages at time of booking the room as it is quite a bit cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in the heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: Juliawolfie
Reviews.Content: This is a new Travelodge and has all the facilities that you'd need for a stay in London with no frills. Staff very friendly and helpful and Bar / Restaurant, vending , machines in site. Despite other reviews regarding noise we found it fine even with 3 hen parties staying there. Quite quiet at night as the area's restaurants and bars serve mostly city workers but there was a good tube service 5 mins walk at Moorgate. Tesco is next door and Boots, Sainsburys and a variety of cafes and sandwich shops are close by. Rooms basic but very clean and tidy. Only slight drawback was lack of air conditioning or fan in room which was slightly uncomfortable with temperatures reaching 25 - 27C. Would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping in an oven”
Reviews.Author: spsdub
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 30 July to the 2 Aug. Once you proceed to the elevator area the heat becomes apparent. There is no air conditioning in this hotel apart from the foyer, which no doubt misleads customers. I was awake half the night with the heat in the room and because the windows only open a few inches there is little that can be done about it. But luckily got an electric fan for the next two nights , which salvaged the stay to some extent. The staff are very friendly and seem to be well aware of the heat issue in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Jacs100
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Travel Lodge in City Road, London was much better than I was expecting, having read previous reviews. Ok, there were no pictures on the walls (and my duvet did have a few dubious stains) but other than that I can't think of one bad thing to say. I paid £55 for a one-night stay - very good value for money and excellently located in the City.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag,neither here nor there”
Reviews.Author: Chillout1571
Reviews.Content: Its in a fantastic location,easily found near old street tube station or moorgate tube station. Also its one of tge only travelodges with free wifi ehich is excellent and starbucks is next door. Aftee check in my keycard worked to get to the kift. I waited 10 mins for lift,when i arrived to ny floor it was like a maze!!! Horrid use of space. I went to my door,key didnt work,so frustrating. No one to ask where stairs where so another 15 mins waiting for lift. I was frustrated by thid point and they just shrugged when i said about the lift and said the stairs arnt meant to be used for general use so use the lift....grrr,lol. Finally after 10 min wait again i got into room. Full of dirty bedding, no towel, no tea bags and stains all over the carpet. I shrugged it off and went to bed after an evening out. The noise from the aircon or whatever was hurrendous,went on all night, told front desk said hotel was full and had to stay in that room....sigh. So overall a mixed bag.

Reviews.Title: “once again a good choice”
Reviews.Author: RamonSpain
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it was a good choice on other trips and once again we have had a pleasant stay on a budget hotel. We were 2 families travelling together and the staff was kind to give as our rooms next to each other. The hotel is located on the city and a quiet area for a weekend. This time we have found the new Sainsbury's supermarket in Old Street very usefulo as it is open 7 days till 11pm and you still have the Tesco next door.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - good location”
Reviews.Author: bobsyerunkle
Reviews.Content: Stayed July 22 2011 for 3 nights on 6th floor in room with window onto city road. A bit of traffic noise but nothing major. Most importantly, room was nice and spacious and clean and towels were changed daily. Didn't have the £8 breakfast, we went to the Wetherspoons on Old Sreet, a 3 minute walk away. Great transport links, Old Street and Moorgate tube stations are a two minute walk along the same road in opposite directions but we got the buses more, plenty use City road and the 205 from Euston stops right outside the hotel door. We bought the travelcards from the tube station for £6.60 which gave unlimted travel for the day...Tesco express a few doors up and a sainsbury local further up as well as subway and cafe nero less than a minute away. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Far too hot!”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyK82
Reviews.Content: We just had 2 problems with our stay and that was the heat and the lack of towels. The room was ridiculously hot and the area by the lifts was also very warm! We had to sleep with the window open but they did not open that much so not much air got in. Also on the day we arrived we had 2 large towels and 1 small one, which was ok, maybe 2 of each would have been better. When we arrived back after our day out we only had 1 large towel and 1 teeny tiny towel. We are both grown adults and found this inadequate. We arrived at 11 to see if we could leave our cases because we were too early to check in only to be told that our room was ready for us which was great! The staff were friendly and helpful, we informed the girl on reception about our problem with the heat and she made a note of it. The room was nice and clean, and it had hangers which was great!

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back here”
Reviews.Author: fabtravel55
Reviews.Content: Location was good for me on this occasion. I should have been suspicious really though, given that it was a fairly last minute booking and still had some availability. I have rarely known London hotels to be so busy - only hostels or very high price rooms available anywhere in zone 1! I booked online and price wasn't cheap at £149 for one person and breakfast extra. I arrived early but check in can' be performed even a minute early as apparently they need to wait for 'their systems to change over'? - what is all that about? Viewed this with suspicion, as was invited to pay more to get in room 40 mins early! Didn't bother and was offered to sit in the bar area and someone would be with me to get me a drink. Almost an hour later, nobody had turned up and I wasn't that bothered really, as by then the room (same as used for all meals taken in hotel) had filled up with people (big student parties it seemed) and luggage, was extremely hot and tables were so sticky that any papers I was trying to read had stuck to them. I decided to return to the foyer and get into the queue that was forming there and I favoured the human check in choice over the machines. By 5 mins past 3 o'clock that part had been completed relatively smoothly and I was quite impressed to be told I had a room on the 1st floor. Even more impressive to find it was close to the lift. That is where being impressed left me! The hotel (and rooms it seems) are a strange shape due to age and previous use of building. It is also unbearably hot in places and no air con. I must have booked one of their last available rooms as it was a disabled room, although I did not have those requirements. The corridor was such a tight turn from the lift though that a wheelchair user would surely struggle to get to the room door. The room overlooked the back of the hotel and so didn't suffer with noise thankfully, as having the only window open a crack (all that is possible) was essential. The window was tiny and if I left the blind up then every other room overlooking this back triangle could see down and into my room. The only view was other postage stamp windows and the odd dirty tissue somebody had lobbed out onto the roof space - not pleasant! The blind was just a plain, grubby cream colour. By contrast to many posts on here, the room itself was vast! It would probably taken around 10 mobility scooters and needed them too! In all of that space stood a solitary, very plain and minimal bed. Just a pillow and white duvet and no colour at all (although the bedding did appear clean). The only other 'furniture' in the whole room was one plastic chair and something resembling a plank for a desk and a small, open hanging space joined to the end. The whole room looked as though someone had moved all the furniture out and then just put a bed back. I coughed and nearly scared myself, as the noise echoed around the space. Although the bed seemed clean, sadly the carpet wasn't and I kept my shoes right by the bed! The TV (stood on the 'shelf') was very basic and no menu facility for programmes. It was all a bit 'old'. The worst was still to cocme though, with the bathroom! Being a disabled room, it was a walk-in wet room. That wouldn't present me with problems - had it been clean! The whole room and shower / toilet area looked as though the floors were dirty - probably from wheelchairs? Not sure, but the floor surface in the shower / toilet area was damaged and had dirty marks and black areas in the cracks and joins. Worse still, at low level the tiles and floor edges were orange with scum and there was no way I was going in there with bare feet. I see cleaner showers on basic camp sites! The shower curtains also had some strange red marks, which could have been scum but looked like dried blood. Good job I was only there one night as the shower didn't appeal! The whole thing was like an 'unpadded cell' and with room for more prisoners beds to be moved in! Breakfast was interesting, as I was already expecting the sticky tables (and not disappointed!). The tables are wiped, but the varnish appears to have given up and is permanently sticky, so surely can't be cleaned hygenically. Even the salt pots are stuck to the tables and it certainly stops you eating with elbows on the table! The food itself wasn't too bad, as they can't go far wrong with cereals and yoghurts that are packaged and there is enough to pick from to get by without having to eat anything prepared by the hotel, if you are by now suspicious of hygiene. The staff were courteous enough as well, although the minute you get up to fetch something else from the self-service buffet, your table is completely cleared. That necessitated starting all over again and fetching another drink etc,, as there was no way I was leaving my handbag on the chair to show the table was in use, given the traffic through the dining area. I had thought a nearly full cup of copy would mean the place might be left for a few minutes, but by the time I had collected a croissant and jam everything had been removed! If I had paid anything under £100, then I might have expected these standards. However, at £149 plus £6.95 for breakfast, I expected something better. Premier Inns and Holiday Inn Express have always been good, basic accommodation and something along the lines I was expecting. This 'hotel' is far inferior. The member of staff on reception did ask if my stay had been comfortable as I handed in my room key card. I replied that the room had been disappointing and her response was that the building was very old and meant that room shapes were unusual. Obviously this must also make cleaning a challenge too?!! About time they reinvested some of the money they charge you in refreshing, repairing and generally maintaining I think. This won't be on my list to return to!.

Reviews.Title: “Spartan and Sketchy, but Price is Right”
Reviews.Author: Denzera
Reviews.Content: I selected Travelodge as having good reputation and good prices in the US and UK, and apparently above-average systems for reservations and customer service. What I got was one of the more bizarre hotel experiences I've ever had, which really didn't befit something in the city center of London. First, the good things: - The location is pretty optimal. 2 minutes to the Old Street tube, 5 minutes' walk to Moorgate and the north side of the City of London. There is lots of nightlife in the area, but if you're on a high floor you can't really hear anything. - This is probably the least expensive hotel which meets basic standards and is very convenient to the city center. We paid an average of £112/night after VAT. - There was free wifi available in the lobby, although it was very slow and inconsistent. Wifi in the rooms cost money, I think £7/day. I went to - Breakfast is decent, the eggs and muffins were good, was not the lap of luxury but I've seen worse. Hot tip: They don't check whether you've paid for breakfast, just whether you're staying in the hotel, so you can bogart a free breakfast if hunger or poverty have overwhelmed your ethics. - There's a bar in the breakfast room, it's fairly well-stocked, and they serve a (very small) menu of food all night. - The rooms were clean. No cleanliness complaints, despite what I'm about to say... Now, the negative. When I say Spartan, I mean it. No expense that could be spared was made, if that makes sense. The room had: - No phone - No clock on the wall or on the nightstand (no alarm clock either) - No extra toilet paper rolls (had to ask the cleaning lady) - No A/C - No hair dryer - No decorations or art of any kind - just bare walls, it was "mental asylum chic" decor - No comforter on the bed. Hope a sheet is enough! In addition: - The bathroom lights were inconsistent and behaved oddly. No light in the shower. - The blinds were really noisy and clattered around - we actually stoppered them with tissues, because otherwise we would've had to close the window, which we couldn't do with no A/C... - Flimsy pillows, no substance to them. Used my travel neck pillow instead. - Haunted elevators. I'm only half-kidding. Buttons would randomly press themselves, the elevators would randomly skip your floor, or stop on other floors that weren't pressed, or reset the whole floor queue. Some buttons refused to operate without a lot of coaxing. Clearly, Travelodge was not interested in paying for an elevator repairman (much less an exorcist). - Poor customer service. Staff would stand around ignoring people, would tell everyone to use the nearby kiosks, and when asked for a simple, routine thing - "could I please have a copy of my check-out receipt", we were told that they can't do such things, that we got a copy electronically over email and should use that. Nevermind that the point of a check-out bill is to make sure you're not being falsely charged for incidentals! So, overall while the hotel met basic needs, it did so in as poor a fashion as possible. If you're pinching pennies it's OK, clean and well-located, but anyone who is looking for a pleasing experience should look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, clean, friendly staff - good value”
Reviews.Author: nixx222
Reviews.Content: We stayed a weekend in early July, arriving Friday afternoon and leaving Sunday morning. This travelodge is clean, not a bit shabby and the staff were all very helpful and friendly. It's well located and close to 2 tube stations. Our room was spotless with a shower, flat screen TV and very, very comfy bed and pillows. It was quiet, but we were at the inner (if you see what I mean) of the hotel rather than on the front. Plenty of pubs, bars and restaurants close by, and around a 10 minute walk to London Bridge. Long tube trip to Wembley (our reason for trip), but the very reasonable room rate made this worthwhile. One quibble - breakfast was not up to much, but is all you can eat, so worth it to fill up for the day! No fried eggs, though, and horrid, bland, rubbery scrambled ones. Sausages were not nice at all. Plenty of choice of cereal, fruit, youghurts and pastries. We'd certainly stay again for a trip to London as we didn't encounter any problems and the place is clean and well maintained, so good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good for the price”
Reviews.Author: teamsmugs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located just a couple of minutes walk from both Old Street and Moorgate tubes so it's fab for getting about. The hotel is, however, on a very busy main road so be aware that front-facing rooms (can't comment on others) are very noisy, even late at night. I had to keep the window closed for this reason which did make the room then very hot. However, I cannot complain as the room was incredibly cheap (£19!!), spotlessly clean and the bed was really really comfy! The only other downside is that you cannot leave your suitcase anywhere - so if you arrive before 3pm (later than average check-in time) you have to pay £10 to check-in early. This might have been something that was advised on the website at the time of booking and perhaps I just missed it, however it was a bit of a surprise to me on arrival so I thought it was worth mentioning here just incase they don't advise it online/others miss it too if it is there. I would stay here again as cost and location really were very good and I did have a great night's sleep too!

Reviews.Title: “Family in Cell block H”
Reviews.Author: JGP119
Reviews.Content: Having used travlodge several times before we thought we knew what to expect........wrong!!!!! On arrival we had to wait for check in as we had arrived too early, no problem this gave us a chance to check out the facilities. An ample bar and a good sized restraunt area with televisions and 4 PC's for internet use. So first impressions were fairly good on what we had seen so far. After a pleasant check-in from one of the employees we proceeded though the door to the lift area. THIS is where the proverbial hit the fan (well it would have done if we had had one). The lift foyers were unbearable and oppressively hot and smelly, the corridors are not that much better, thankfully we were only on the second floor and used the stairs a lot but even then a sat nav would have been useful to find them. The room was AWFUL, it was extremely tight and narrow and was far from being a family room, I would struggle to describe it as a double actually. The window is set out quite high looking out on to a disused building opposite which served to add to the feeling of quite "prison like". The bed was extremely soft and uncomfortable and you slid into the middle all the time and with no air conditioning became exceedingly hot at night which gave us sleepless nights along with the expected noise. The bathroom faired even worse, the air extractor didnt work which left you feeling rather faint by the time you had finished your shower and made the bathroom smell of damp continually, the soap was never replenished(had to complain before I got any more) paint was peeling off the walls and generally the cleanliness was of a poor standard. We did not eat very much in the restaraunt as the food was of the usual frozen chuck it in the deep fat fryer range served on tables that were very sticky. The location of this hotel is ok and has plenty of shops etc close by. There are are 2 tube stations within 5 minutes walk and service is generally very good, however to get to the centre of London you do need to change tubes and if you dont have any savvy about you could become quite confusing. Overall - Good location with good local amenities and good transport links. Travelodge advertises great value accomodation and at £19 or £29 a night I would agree however 2 of our nights were in excess of £70 and at that price I would expect more. We stopped at a Lenny Henry hotel on our way home for £29 and it was delightful. TRAVELODGE - NEVER AGAIN !!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Expect more than 'some exterior noise'.”
Reviews.Author: domino_w
Reviews.Content: If you look at the travelodge description for this hotel, there is a warning to expect 'some exterior noise'. This would be more accurate if it read 'expect to be disturbed all night long'. It could also add, there is double glazing in a feeble attempt to lessen the noise, but no air conditioning, so if it gets too hot, you cannot open the windows, because the noise will then become unbearable. You could even contact Travelodge to raise this issue, only to find it takes 2 weeks for them to send a standard 'we did warn you' reply. Avoid or don't sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Blessing”
Reviews.Author: RonnyG
Reviews.Content: This hotel presents a basic conundrum to the frugal traveller: when does a bargain become a poor choice? We were in over the weekend of 30 June-3 July, so experienced one workday night, Friday and Saturday nights, and Sunday night. Sunday was the only night when the noise level from outside the room was what I'd call "low". Saturday night was disturbing, with a loud party outside and all the noise reverberating around the buildings, and it went on through the wee hours. The other two nights were tolerable. My advice is to bring ear plugs, just in case. The room itself, on floor 1 facing Tabernacle St was spartan and very clean, with a teapot and coffee/tea, sugar etc for the morning brew. One small bar of soap was provided in the bath. Towels are of excellent quality, very large and absorbent. Pillows are small, and the basic mattress was covered with a base sheet and a very nice comforter. We requested bedding for the sofa bed and received it promptly. Hot water was in plentiful supply. Despite the noise we experienced I still give this hotel a good rating because of the positive room attributes and its location relative to many places of interest, good transport by numerous bus routes and Moorgate and Old Street underground stations a short walk, and proximity to Spitalfields. If the hotel restaurant doesn't suit you there are many choices within a short walking distance. Over the weekend the neighborhood slows down (except for nightlife). Customer service was helpful in sorting out a reservation change using the telephone once we got through to the right person; my opinion of the website and first point of contact for customer service is that there's room for improvement. Otherwise check in was smooth. Summation: noise level for my room was almost enough to make me question my choice, but the positives outweigh that one big negative and combined with a very competitive room tariff provide the incentive to give this one your consideration when researching hotels in central London.

Reviews.Title: “Building too warm, water only just warm enough.”
Reviews.Author: Ahar
Reviews.Content: Check-in was performed quickly and efficiently by a machine next to the unmanned reception. The room was very clean. The building is a sort of hollow triangle in shape - my room faced the inside of the triangle so it didn't suffer from traffic noise outside the window but there was the constant drone of air conditioning equipment from down below. The mattress was very soft - you sank into it quite a bit which wasn't to my taste. In the evening there seemed very little hot water. The shower ran warm for less than a minute and then settled at merely tepid. Early next morning was better and the shower stayed warm the whole time but even turned up to the maximum it wasn't what you'd call hot. Despite all the noise coming from the AC equipment outside, the corridors were uncomfortably warm. The only encounter I had with the staff was at breakfast - they seemed friendly enough. I got the room for a cheap rate so I didn't that it wasn't great but I wouldn't be happy paying their top rates.

Reviews.Title: “You get what u pay for (and don't get what u don't pay for )”
Reviews.Author: DurbanDweller
Reviews.Content: Bare bones, no frills. No soap/shampoo - byo! 1 of the 3 lifts out of order. The other 2 overworked (stop all floors, packed). No fans no aircon = hot rooms. Windows only open a few inches (WTH, are Travelodge guests suicidal?) No ventilation throughout = hot hotel. Restaurant is worth avoiding. Sticky tables. Food prepared so quickly you just know it ain't fresh (2 mins for a bland piping hot burger = premade and nuked in the microwave). Not an awful hotel by any means. Def clean and "acceptable"; just don't expect any pleasant surprises!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: Jamesc9954
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last August and again a few months before. On both visits i stayed for two nights as a base for a london trip to see a few shows and do some shopping. Check in is easy when using their self service check in. However they are quite strict at the time of check in. You can not check in any early then the time to state unless you pay a fee which is in contrast to Premier Inn as they allow you to check in a little earlier only if the rooms are ready. The room was basic and what you would expect from a travelodge. If you are fussy about your hotel and have specific requirments then i would not recomend. Its not the four seasons. The price i paid was cheap and it was worth the money i paid. The room and bathroom was clean and comfortable but again very basic. Tea and coffee making facilities avaliable. No toiletries, so take your own. Room was quite hot but the hotel provided a fan. Overall it was a clean and comfortable stay and considering all we needed from the hotel was a roof over our head at night it done the job. I would recommend travelodge to anyone travelling to London on a budget but if you want a bit more go to Premier Inn. Travelodge is basic and it does not shout from the roof tops about top quality and their prices reflect this.

Reviews.Title: “Scruffy, smelly dump never again!”
Reviews.Author: JLavender
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the bleak unmanned scruffy reception, eventually a young guy came out of the back office and gave me a room. Spent the next half an hour changing room's "twice" because both rooms had a weird damp dirty smell. No food after 10pm meant I had to go forage, luckily there is a small Tesco's next door. Worn mattress, old thin pillows and walls made of paper did not contribute to a good nights sleep. Hardly any hot water for a shower or shave and no iron and ironing board. Great, so I arrived at our London office to meet the big boss looking like I had slept in my suit and shirt, sporting a half day growth and half asleep......... Thank you Travel Lodge "for nothing" Good points: Breakfast was "not bad" Staff generally tried their best I used to use a 2 star Cairo hotel as my worst stay experience, congratulations Travellodge you have taken their crown. Their tag line is "Welcome to the hotel revolution" more like "Welcome to the hotel revulsion"

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Edward1956
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights over a bank holiday weekend - and lived to tell the tale! There's a bus stop outside - and it's easy to get to lots of other places by buses and underground within easy walking distance. My room was of good size and clean - though totally without character. Breakfast (book ahead online if you can: it's cheaper) is fine but time things carefully if you don't want queues. Dinner, too, is cheap and cheerful, cheaper and cheerfuller if you book beforehand online. I stayed in Central London for two nights, dinner bed and breakfast, one person, for about £85 in all. I'll be back. Lenny Henry's hotels, in my experience, NEVER deliver the basic price they always offer ...

Reviews.Title: “really good location with comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: teresac83
Reviews.Content: after reading the reviews on this i was a bit wary and didnt know what to expect. after saying that i would definately recommend this hotel to people as there is a tesco express and starbucks a few doors down. moorgate tube is within walking distance. for value for money this hotel is worth it. although it is basic we only needed a bed to sleep in at night so it did the job. there was no noise which i was expecting but we will definately be back

Reviews.Title: “Night noise”
Reviews.Author: cirentrip
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was spoilt by excessive noise from a nearby club/restaurant, which went on until 4.30 am, with loud music, shouting, shrieking, and car doors slamming and engines revving. Also, within the hotel, bedroom and corridor doors were slamming shut and people were running around and talking loudly in the corrridors until around 3.30 am. This was on the 4th floor, and my room overlooked a side street, at the end of which was the offending club/restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Rather basic but practical location.............”
Reviews.Author: Claire4567
Reviews.Content: First impression was the spartan reception. The chap in the queue before me at the desk was complaining that his room had no toilet rolls, towels, tea or milk - oh dear! That said, checked in swiftly, room was spartan but perfectly comfortable. For a city hotel managed a very quiet night which was unexpected. The lifts were very hit and miss, you have to allow an extra five minutes to your journey!! I did ask to borrow a hairdryer and for a wake up call, to be told this service not available, and could I return the hairdryer in 45 minutes! So, just need to be prepared. Breakfast was ample and adequate and the staff were all pleasant. All in all, you get what you pay for. Suited the needs of the day and was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: Merevaik
Reviews.Content: This is a rather impersonal Travelodge but it has all the necessary requirements for a single night stay. The hotel is located near Moorgate underground station and is well located for activities in the City centre. There is a fast "self service" check in and this worked quite well. There are very few staff and things are a bit impersonal. The room was clean and there was both a fridge and a flat screen TV. The bathroom has a good shower although the room is rather small. On the day we stayed one of the lifts was not working. This would have caused a problem for some people. There is a reasonable breakfast room but we did not take breakfast. The room was booked direct from the Travelodge website and we paid a reduced rate as a late booking. This is a good way to book rooms and it made the stay reasonable value.

Reviews.Title: “Good first impression but soon changed our minds!”
Reviews.Author: itzmee
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family room on the 2nd floor at the back which was spacious and clean. There were plenty of supplies for making coffee and tea. The secondary glazing kept out the day time noise but this changed at night and no-one got a good night's sleep - the noisy doors from the neighbouring rooms didn't help when they slammed shut. The bed was large but had a big dip in the centre and we had to ask for extra pillows as only one was supplied per person. Breakfast was ok, the eggs weren't too nice but everything else was fine, the staff constantly topped up the food and were happy to help with any problems as I had to ask for more orange juice when it ran out. We stayed for 2 nights but wish we hadn't - even my 8yr old son wanted to go home to his own bed! The hotel is in a very good location for sightseeing but one night is more than enough!

Reviews.Title: “Good location with coffee shop next door.”
Reviews.Author: Claire_Lancs
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel a few months in advance to try to get the best deal, to get cheaper rooms we booked each night seperately to take advantage of Travelodges £29 rooms. All but one night was booked as a supersaver meaning we couldn't change the booking but out of interest we checked the prices a few days in advance of our trips and found the night when we had booked a flexible rate the price had come down. Using their website we were able to take advantage of the cheaper price and get cash credited back to our card. Nice one Travelodge! The hotel is located 10 mins from Old Street Tube Station so you only need a zone 1 & 2 travelcard (£6.60 each) to whizz around the city all day. It's a couple of stops from Euston station. They charge you an extra £10 to check in before 3pm and there is no left luggage facility so I recommend timing your journey not to get there too early. There are easy to use, self check in machines in reception if there is a queue. There are plenty local places to eat and drink, a Tesco Metro and small Sainsbury's within a few minutes walk. There are pubs and cafe's also. I would however recommend eating in the city during the evening as we didn't find anywhere to eat after the cafes closed at approx 6pm. There is a bus stop right outside that will take you to London Bridge. The hotel itself has a late night bar and serves food until approx 10pm, they show TV in the bar area. If you are looking for late night food, the hotel advertises room service throughout the night but when we asked they said there was no food available??? That was our only complaint for the duration of our stay as the hotel was perfect for us. You know what you're going to get with a Travelodge, nothing fancy but clean and tidy. As we didn't spend much time at the hotel and it was in such a great location we found it ideal. We asked for extra pillows and got these no problem and we weren't disturbed by noise at all despite there being a few large coach parties staying at the same time as us. If you get a room on the front there is a good chance you will be disturbed by traffic noise. We had a great stay and lovely time in London.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: CJM88
Reviews.Content: On arrival we 'checked-in' at a computer, found our room easily and made ourselves comfortable. When we left we did this in reverse, except a man took our key from us at the front door, so we had very little to do with the staff. We slept well and the room was comfortable enough, but small and quite hot. Views from the window were of the rest of the hotel - everything was very close and it seemed like there was no air. Position was everything, as it was easy to move around London from here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - But sleepless nights”
Reviews.Author: buckyCumbria
Reviews.Content: Went with family for a weekend break. The Hotel was fine for value, location, cleanliness, however, the noise was horrendous. We were in a family room on the 2nd floor next to the main road. It was sweltering heat and no air con, so you either had a very hot night with uncomfortable sort of sleep or had no sleep due to having the window open. Whoever plans the room allocations really needs to look at the audience and who will be using the rooms. Why would you put a family soo close to the main road and so low down, at least the noise might have been more bearable on the 7th floor. Food was fine and the staff very pleasant. If I was there for the night life the room allocation would have been fine, but not with a young family.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Defn
Reviews.Content: Right - this hotel isnt the best, it isnt the nicest and it is by no means amazing or luxurious BUT... I was really pleased and very surprised. I was expecting it to be noisy, basic, a bit cheap in terms of decor etc and generally shabby but it was hardly any of those things. The bed was comfy and the room was cool which is a must for me as i am quite a hot blooded person and hotels are usually always too hot and i can never cool down enough to get a decent sleep. I actually ended up putting the heater on at one stage which was such a novelty for me. Breakfast was fine, nothing special but you get what you pay for. Close to tube and train, which is always good in London. I must add though that i got a room that faced one of the inside courtyards so i cannpt comment on the noise from the road side but if you can ask for an internal room or a high floor, you'll be sorted

Reviews.Title: “No frills but does the job”
Reviews.Author: batbuilder
Reviews.Content: A cheap , clean hotel. Bit noisy on the main road but very convenient. Very computerised, didn't see many members of staff but the ones we did were nice

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy worst hotel ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Bosh4
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our children in a family room on the 1st floor, we had no sleep the whole night, people were shouting, cars racing, horns going music on max. No double glazing or sound proofing at all we might as well have had the window open, my parents were at the front of the hotel and we were out the back and both rooms were the same for noise. We had tea, coffee and sugar sachets but no kettle to make a drink. The location is good but unless you are there for the clubs I would avoid at all cost

Reviews.Title: “Great for weekend in London”
Reviews.Author: andy-iow
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed for one Saturday night only cost £40 each absolute bargain for central London. Quick check in and rooms were big compared with other hotels we have stayed in. Everything was clean and bed was comfortable. We were on floor 7 and lifts were all working - no delays getting to room and NO PROBLEMS WITH NOISE (this may have been because the city area is deserted at weekends). Only 5 minutes walk to Moorgate or Liverpool St stations. Plenty of good pubs and restaurants around. Would highly recommend if you are looking for good value accommodation for a weekend stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for London”
Reviews.Author: jimmyt7
Reviews.Content: Good location with easy access to buses and the Northern line tube. Good price and OK rooms. Above average Travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic - student accommodation standard”
Reviews.Author: sonicUk
Reviews.Content: Its a new frills hotel but that doesn't mean that it has to be this depressing, Its more like student halls or residence than a hotel. Bathroom was tired, no toiletries, no view. Breakfast is terrible, best avoid and go to one of the local cafes. Good things are the location - very central - and the beds are surprisingly comfortable. Will not stay again unless I only needed a bed,

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: Kristin0909
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice, and been very happy with it both times. It's nothing special, but it is very good for what it is. It's cheap, clean and in a good location. Most of the staff I've been in contact with have been friendly and helpful. I will probably stay here again, since a cheap and good hotel in London isn't easy to come by. Avoid the resturant though, the food is pretty bad.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: VandanaGombar
Reviews.Content: Its well located, well-connected (with a tube station on either side) and provides a reasonably comfortable stay. There is a restaurant on the premises and multiple eating options around, which are just short walks away. Perfect place to stay on a no-frills official trip.

Reviews.Title: “good for the low price”
Reviews.Author: cookerg
Reviews.Content: This bare-bones hotel is all about economy in a pricy city. The room is sparsely furnished with one chair for the desk, no rack or bench for your suitcase, and no phone in the room. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable, the room heater and television worked properly and the hot water was hot. The wi-fi internet cost extra but worked seamlessly. There was a kettle and coffee powder. An ironing board could be requested and we were cheerfully given extra towels on request. It's very close to two tube stops and a grocery store and there is a bus stop in front and a taxi phone. Thus for the very basic price you got a basic and acceptable room. Problems: the three elevators were always breaking down and were too few and too cramped for the hotel size. However the stairwell was wide, well-lit, carpeted and not steep. The shower/tub was quite deep and set above the floor, so a shorter elderly person might have trouble stepping out - although the handrail helped. The bathroom mirror was set back and hard to use for makeup, but the one over the desk worked better. The breakfast buffet was plentiful, and tasty except for the powdery scrambled eggs. The door wasn’t soundproof so a lot of loud conversations in the hall were annoying. My wife missed having an ice machine for drinks.

Reviews.Title: “A pretty good London hotel for a decent price - bring a plug”
Reviews.Author: RandomSnackfood
Reviews.Content: Travelodges are largely all the same, so you do roughly know what you're getting when you book, though admittedly they do vary in the detail. I found this hotel to be fine. I used the self-check in machine when I arrived, which meant I got in quickly. I had a double room on the top floor which was really quite big. I had a bath and a shower, though I couldn't have a bath as there were no plugs in the bathroom. It wasn't too noisy, in fact I think it wasn't even full the night I stayed and Old Street is a good location. The room was clean and comfortable, I slept well, the breakfast was usual for a travelodge - not great, even worse if you're a vegetarian and with terrible coffee, but that's standard fare. It cost me £55 for a double room and although I was travelling alone and booked as a lone traveller, I was given two breakfast tickets, so two people could have had breakfast for the £6 extra a paid, which isn't bad.

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge business trip”
Reviews.Author: happyzeeman
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Good location. Proximity of tube. Breakfast buffet is of a good quality and quantity but everyday same. The dishes from bar restaurant are not advisable. Bad quality and small quantity for thé price. Good hotel for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain - great location, excellent price”
Reviews.Author: SubaruDriver
Reviews.Content: For a no-frills hotel in the City of London, for the price you pay you can't really complain. I had a room on the 7th floor, overlooking City Road, but I could hear the traffic. It might be worth asking for a room on the other side. Room is sparse, but clean and being as the hotel is fairly new in good shape. The room doesn't come with toiletries, so don't forget your shampoo. I booked via the travelodge website and this is well documented though. Via the hotel website you also get the opportunity to purchase breakfast, internet etc. I didn't use any other facilities so cannot compare or note here of their qualities. I did check in very late at night (1am) though and was welcomed by a friendly face which was nice. Even accounting for this fact, the lobby was lively - the bar area seemed in full flow - the hotel gives me the impression that it's a bit of a party hotel - not a bad thing..... To get to your room you need your room key in the lift which is a nice security feature. Also, being as I was checking-in that late I needed to ring for access which is also a good sign. The hotel is in a great location for the city, Islington, Shoreditch. Would stay again, but only as an overnighter type hotel - somewhere to lay your head, have a shower and so on. Could imagine this place will be heaving and 100% full for the month of December!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: maccas37
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 10 nights between 3rd and 13th February. We had individual bookings for each night to get the best price and were initially told we would have to re-check in each day. After about the third day, the manager organised for our entire booking to be entered into the system and we had no further problems. Our room was a double on the first floor with a window opening onto an internal view of the hotel. No Traffic noise. No corridor noise. No lift noise. Unfortunately on the first day we also had no hot water. (Mrs Maccas37 was NOT impressed) Throughout our stay the hot-water occasionally ran out in the evenings, but was always OK in the mornings. The shower didn’t drain particularly well either. Of the three lifts in the building one was out of service for our entire stay and a second was out of order for about three days, but as we were on the first floor we often took the stairs anyway. Breakfast was plentiful but at over 7 pounds each, was a bit pricey. We made the call that it was worth it as it meant we could nip down for breakfast, then return to the room to brush our teeth and get ‘rugged up’ for the wintery weather on the streets of London. We tried the restaurant once in the evening and it was dreadful. There are at least 3 or 4 places nearby to get a decent meal. Because we were staying for an extended period, we needed to do some clothes washing and found a place in Holborn that we were able to get to by catching a bus from just near Old Street Station. Very handy as we were able to drop the clothes off for a ‘service wash’ in the morning, catch the tube from Holborn Station to wherever we wanted to go, then pick the clean clothes up on the way back. Overall, as others have said, this hotel is a Travelodge and the room was great value for money. There are also plenty of coffee shops and mini-supermarkets nearby. No.1 Sports Bar next door is a great place to watch the football. We also walked from the hotel to the Museum of London. (Walk down City Road to Moorgate Station, turn right and walk about the same distance again) It’s a great Museum – fascinating in so many ways.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Joby_lake
Reviews.Content: For no frills this place is in a great location – Old Street station at one end and Moorgate (with access to other underground lines other than the Northern Line) at the other. You get what you pay for – basic accommodation, tv and tea/coffee. If you want luxury go elsewhere and pay for it. We were hardly in the room and it was perfectly adequate for what we needed – a room to sleep in. Bed was comfortable, pillows nice, plenty of very hot water, a heater that could be turned off (I don’t like the heat) and a window that could be opened. We were on the road side of the hotel (our choice) but a word of warning, you can hear the traffic outside and at busy times it is constant. Breakfast is buffet style – we only had one as we went to My Old Dutch at High Street Kensington for pancakes (see other review) on the other morning. There is a bus stop right outside which serves Liverpool Street and Waterloo stations. There are also loads of coffee shops on City Road and a Tesco Metro and a Sainsburys to the right of the hotel going up to Old Street Station. All in all a good experience at this Travelodge and I would use again.

Reviews.Title: “You know what you're going to get with a Travelodge - clean, cheap and good sized room”
Reviews.Author: sirlswirl
Reviews.Content: Chose this place for a one night stay in London for a theatre break. Like always Travelodge is good value compared to similar rated hotels and you know what you can expect. It was a bit of a trek to get to on the tube. Once off the tube we managed to walk the wrong way down city road but eventually found it not too far down the road the other way. So a sign would be good. The area wasn't the nicest and the building advertised on the photos isn't the one you stay in. We managed to check in quickly as we were in a rush to get to the theatre. Our room was a good size and clean. We had a TV and tea making facilities and a nice sized bed. We had no view as the window looked onto another part of the building but that was no matter to us. The window was very large though so the room was nice and light. The bathroom was a good size too but the shower seemed like a hospital shower as it just had a basin and a curtain which was a bit offputting. We weren't bothered by anyone during our stay and couldn't hear any noise from other rooms, the corridor or the road. So we had a really good nights sleep. The blinds were good at keeping the light out for a lie in. Check out was easy as we just had to give in the key.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: Phillipa68
Reviews.Content: No complaints at all! Paid £49 in advance for a double room a short walk from the tube station. It was basic, yes but clean, warm with a tv and tea/coffee facilities. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “same food everyday!”
Reviews.Author: Pidro_c4
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this lodge for 11 days and their buffet breakfast is the same everyday! The only reason we stayed in this hotel is due to it's proximity to our technical training facility. Everything is no frills here just a place to rest your head. Although it's central location gives you access to a lot of restaurants, pubs, bars, discos, and supermarket. Transport is quite easy, there's a bus station right in front and it's near 3 train station (5-10 min walk). It's like staying in a semi-automated hotel, you don't have much staff-client interaction. check-in and check-out can be made thru a machine. And the main door is also card operated which is ok but sort of a security concern. One can just wait for somebody to come in and follow you inside.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic”
Reviews.Author: Baronessaren
Reviews.Content: It's a travel lodge so cannot expect for more, very basic with no toiletries provided. Only stayed for a night though as the location was near where i need to be the following morning. Good value for money as it's cheap and cheerful.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and cheap”
Reviews.Author: insol
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed here the Friday night just before Christmas with our 13 year old and 5 year old daughters. we booked a couple of months in advance so room only cost £50 which for Friday night in the city is a bargain. conveniently located with a short walk to moorgate tube. room was clean and serviceable. we were on the third floor facing the back and the room was quiet. we opted for the breakfast which was fab too. plenty to eat and ok quality bearing in mind what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “does exactly what is needed”
Reviews.Author: AnnabelleCornwall
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times now as it is in a very convenient location for my venue when I am travelling for business. The room was clean and quite spacious, being a corner room it was a bit of an odd shape, but had windows to the front and side. Being at the front of the building and on the second floor I was a bit worried about traffic noise, but I needn't have been as it didn't bother me at all. The temperature was ok, neither too warm or too cold. There was no bath, only a shower and the shower tray did not drain very well, leaving me standing up to my ankles in water and worried about flooding. When I returned to the bathroom an hour later the water was still draining, think the drains need a good clean. Out of three lifts, only two were working, so it took a while to leave in the morning as the lift was full by the time it got down to the 2nd floor. All in all, an ok, unmemorable stay, but good enough if you are just spending a night here.

Reviews.Title: “basic”
Reviews.Author: tilling311
Reviews.Content: origionaly we had booked a family room for two adults and two teenagers,the room consisted of a double bed and sofa bed which when extended joined onto the double bed leaving zero floor space,so we ended up booking a double room as well!!!!so i would say a family room is only suitable for 2 adults and 2 young children.rooms were basic ok for what we wanted,somewhere to dress for the evening and to sleep.we booked breakfast which was realy rather good,cereals,pastrys,full english all buffet style.kids under 15 eat free which was a bonus.whatever you do dont use recomended NCPcarpark,we were broken into,its a hot spot acording to police!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not glam, but do you care?”
Reviews.Author: millenniumperegrine
Reviews.Content: Whether I would recommend this hotel depends on what you want it for. For a double room, even by Travelodge standards it is pretty basic. The room was very small, had no view, a small bathroom, no chairs, and completely bare white-painted walls (which did start to give me strange institutional vibes...). So if you want a lap-of-luxury stay, this is not a good place to go. However, if you want it (as we did) as a cheap springboard into central London, just a place to leave your stuff, sleep, and generally spend little time in, there is no problem at all. It is 5 minutes walk from Old Street and Moorfield stations, and walking into central London is definately do-able (we timed a walk from Westminster to the hotel at just under an hour). It was clean, quiet, in a well-lit area, has metro supermarkets and pubs nearby (though the latter seem to be closed on Sundays, be warned). Overall it was very suitable to our needs, but as I said, if you are looking for a hotel room with facilities which make it a place you'd like to spend part of your day in, this possibly is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what it is”
Reviews.Author: snappieT
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, 5 minutes walk from Old Street Tube Station, which is on the Northern Line. Frequent tubes to Kings Cross & Bank connect you up with pretty much anywhere else in the underground network. Stayed in a family room, which consisted on a double bed and a sofa with slide-out divan underneath for one, and movable cushions on top for another. Had to put bed linen on this ourselves, but it was provided in the room. Room and hotel was clean, staff at reception very prompt and professional when we needed extra towels, all in all quite good. Negatives involved a strict check-in policy of 3PM - a surcharge of £10 applies otherwise. I don't understand this, the rooms become ready over time, not all together suddenly at 3PM. One of the (3) lifts was broken when we arrived, and a second fell out of service during our stay. No toiletries provided in the room, but this is standard for Travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, a bit too cheap and not that cheerful”
Reviews.Author: eustatius
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night while visiting a couple of tourist attractions in London. The price for a double room was surprisingly high - similar to other London hotels, despite it being a "cheap" Travelodge - although it's fairly central so that might be why. The automatic sliding doors at the front of the hotel have "Welcome" printed on them, so it's a bit of a surprise to everyone that they do precisely nothing when you approach them from the outside. Security is understandable in London, but while waiting in the lobby saw dozens of people nearly bumping into the doors because of the mixed message of the signs. Even for a budget hotel the rooms are incredibly sparse, without phone or indeed TV remote control. One of the three lifts was out of order when we were there, and the corridors were piercingly white and spare, like a conference centre. Our room was functional, but that was it. Compared to similar hotels it felt like someone had gone in before us and removed anything that might make it feel relaxing. The walls were white and bare (except where they'd been scuffed), the furniture all rock-hard pine/MDF, we're still not sure our heater worked, there was no bath mat, the bathroom was a bit damp-towel smelly (although spotlessly clean) and the single chair was one of those stackable plastic ones. If you tripped anywhere in the room you'd land on either a sharp corner or the bed. None of the hen or stag do's we saw milling in the foyer actually kept us awake in the end, but around 3.30am we were subjected to ten minutes of incredibly loud drum & bass that shook the windows. It's still not clear where from: maybe a nearby club was doing some grand finale, or maybe it was just a renegade taxi. The hotel was sharply understaffed, although what staff we saw were polite; frequently queues would develop at the front desk when the only person staffing it was required elsewhere. Checking out was a complete mystery - the desk was deserted when we did so - and we think we were right in just discarding our keycard in a slot provided. Who knows? Maybe even now they're wondering where we got to. All in all, it was a place to lay our heads, and there was no real deal breaker - and you could probably do worse in central London - but in future we'd go for somewhere a little further out, as the overwhelming sparseness and shoestringness (even compared to Travelodges and Premier Inns elsewhere) didn't really add to the enjoyment of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but does the job”
Reviews.Author: RS10675
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Travelodge a few times. It's conveniently central and does the job - clean, basic rooms with a bed and a bathroom which is pretty much all I'm after. If you want more frills, go elsewhere, but for a cheap place to use as a base if you're visiting this part of London it's hard to beat. I've never had problems with reservations, although I tend to check in by 5pm. The noise at the back of the hotel can be a problem, but many of the rooms look into an internal courtyard or the main road. Ultimately I think this is good value for what you get - a very convenient location and adequate, if basic, rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: JNK883
Reviews.Content: If you want basic and cheap and good location then this is perfect. Not a glamorous hotel but for the time i spent there it was perfect. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: AlexBentley91
Reviews.Content: upon arrival we checked in to find a mediocre room that was adequate for our two night stay... (good thing it was only two nights as when in bed (if there are two of you) you seem to meet in the middle.) can't expect much for the price we paid, but the staff were friendly enough, although one night we ordered pizza and i was told that i couldnt have the tomato one, as it wasnt in stock... and when it came out cold, the barman told us.. 'he had put it in for 3minutes!!!' with a surprised look on his face, as i was hungry i didnt contemplate that the £9 pizza had probably been bought for a £1 at the tesco express down the road. hotel was quiet and breakfast was good, plenty of choice and not long ques even though it was prime time, great location for the bus routes and tubes!

Reviews.Title: “Good value.”
Reviews.Author: eraedcn
Reviews.Content: Best located hotel if flying with Ryanair, only 10 minute walk from Liverpool St. Railway station. Local wetherspoon pub served very good cooked breakfast for 3.99 gbp .. better value then macdonalds !!! Hotel is right beside a small supermarket, Tesco and there is a Sansbury another 200m up the road. 7 nights for 250 gbp. Great value ... need to book early.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value on the 'Saver' rate - don't stay here at rack rate.”
Reviews.Author: lincolnshireposy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on numerous occasions since its opening a few years ago. Initially the Lodge was clean and fresh, however, it has clearly had scant attention paid to it since then. Additionally, I have seen even the most basic facilities whittled away - mattress covers have disappeared (sheets straight onto the mattress hostel style) and the reviewer who noted the lack of toilet paper was not a one-off. New Express check-in machines now dominate half of the reception desk area, sadly all were out of order, worse the staff were unaware as they were busy dealing with the consequential build-up at the desk. We ate in the Lodge on our first night - the price was in line with other budget chains (think Pizza Hut, Cafe Rouge), but the food was dire. I was expecting reheated pre-prepared food, however, whilst the food was indeed pre-prepared the 'chef' was unable to even reheat it adequately. Drinks are not cheap and cheerful pub chain prices either. Now, if you are paying less than £30 then the Lodge still represents excellent value as it is clean and warm, but for the full rate you can do much better. My star ratings are based on value at the lower end price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location !! TUBES /BARS”
Reviews.Author: ickle-linzi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a travelodge deal so what we got for our money was acceptable .However if we had paid normal rates i would have been dissapointed ..The shower took over 20min to warm up and the room window looked over the bar roof which was in need of a tidy up ,the bed was also not very comfortable.The staff were helpful and checking in was swift and easy .The location is buy far the best thing there is a small indian restaurant opp "The Curry Leaf" WOW best food ever ..More than resonable prices for london and the food was probably the best i have ever tried ...Would most definately visit again..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: littlelizzy666
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about location! It is a few minutes walk away from old street tube station, which will take you to central london in a matter of a few minutes! To get a hotel this central, which is clean, safe and very cheap is a minor mirical!! The staff were very friendly, there is a resteraunt, which is fairly priced although nothing fancy and a number of bars etc close by! We had a very comfortable room and really enjoyed our stay. We will deffo return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Average”
Reviews.Author: CBRY
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night while in London on a hen weekend. This was not a good location if you are not familar with london. Very far away from west end and tourist attractions. Great value for money and rooms were clean and very modern. The lift area on our floor was avery tatty and carpet was dirty - but this didnt bother us we were only there for 1 night. Check out was very fast.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid At All Cost”
Reviews.Author: EuropeCanadian
Reviews.Content: Miserable experience. I arrived at 3am (snow delays) and needed a wake up call the next morning. They told me that is not a service they offer - that is a first for me, at any hotel anywhere in over 25 years of travel. No alarm clock in room either. I begged (important early meeting in the morning) and they agreed to wake up call. Then they DID NOT do it. I awoke late, of course. No toiletries in the room - not even a bar of soap. That`s also a first. In a bad way. No heat in the room: They didn`t repair it until the 3rd day. Filthy elevators - gum all over the floor, plus filth. Summary: It was charmless, missing basics that business travelers require, and basics like heating that humans require; plus indifferent, unhelpful service all adds up to an experience I will never repeat. And one that makes me avoid all Travelodges in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Overall - Adequate but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Chaz-b98
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, as I was booked on a training course just around the corner. Like other travellers have mentioned, you MUST contact the hotel to ensure you get a room if you are going to arrive later than 3pm. Check in was fast, room OK but a bit sparse on amenities, TV, kettle, towels and that's it. The room was comfortable, and although on the front, was fairly quiet at night. The breakfast ( pre-paid) was excellent. You I stay again? If the company were paying, yes. If I were paying, NO.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you ring ahead”
Reviews.Author: JPGSunderland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this travelodge on a friday night due to its location to where we needed to be the following morning. I rang ahead to confirm my booking (as usual) to be told that as i was arriving late (10pm) my room may be given away. Of course i was not happy with this so rang customer services who spoke to the reception staff stating that we would be arriving late. An early scare sorted. I requested a quiet room and was promptly given a room on top floor and at the back of the hotel. Really nice room, open and light. Very clean. No noise either so good nights sleep for all. I would stay here again but will always ring ahead to confirm my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Rooms but lacking basic amenities”
Reviews.Author: DelhiGlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the travelodge recently. The travelodge is economically priced compared to the high priced oxford street hotels and is also not very far from the oxford street. However, it is a no frill hotel. There is no soap in the washrooms nor is there an iron in the room. The hotel reception will give you an iron with a prewarning to return within 30 minutes after which they charge a penalty. The irons are not very good and the one given to me put stains on my clothes. The checkin time is very late i.e. 3 p.m. and they charge an additional 10 pounds if you want a room earlier. They are not very careful while creating key cards and one day a person entered into my room because the reception had given him a key card erroneously with my room number. Overall, not a pleasant experience to stay at the travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “quite good hotel”
Reviews.Author: stephenCoAntrim
Reviews.Content: stayed one night, had booked during Travelodge sale so got room for £20 (Sun night). The hotel is overall quite comfortable with all essential amenities. The only drawback for me would be the constant noise of traffic outside, continually throughout the night resulting in poor sleep quality. Otherwise quite good.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, but great value and surprisingly spacious”
Reviews.Author: Andrew C
Reviews.Content: I think we paid about £35 for our double room at this hotel, which is fantastically cheap given the really good location. The hotel is very close to Old Street station and only slightly further from Moorgate station, so it's easy to get to everywhere. There's nothing special about this place, but it's very clean and modern. The mattress, duvet and pillows are a bit too thin really, but it's OK for one night. The hot water seemed to get switched off at night, which was a pain because we didn't get back from the show we went to see until midnight. On the plus side the room was pretty large and quiet, and the guy at the bar happily made us pizza even though it was well past the time they serve food until. All in all this is a very basic, no frills hotel in the centre of London for £35 and I was happy with that.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Leoandjack
Reviews.Content: Handy for the city and very close to Old St tube station. However you cannot leave luggage and if you want check in before 3.00 pm then it'll cost you another £10.00. Breakfast offered little choice and was of a mediocre quality.

Reviews.Title: “Rather disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ianjmorley
Reviews.Content: I get the Travelodge business model but this was a bit of a let down......I was forced to use the "express" check in machine, despite the fact my travel agent had made the booking and did not provide me with a confirmation number. You need either this or the credit card with which you made the booking to use the machines. With neither I had to go to reception where a non-helpful lady thumbed through a lengthy document to find a confirmation number. I then had to go and re-join the "express" check in queue. Why the receptionist couldnt simply check me in is beyond me. The room is spartan and not terribly exciting. It was freezing cold as the wall mounted heater was switched off. The only way I could get any heat to come out of it was to have it on full. Even with that I felt cold during the night as the duvets the provide is wafer thin. I had a room facing the road which was very noisy even with the window shut. The bathroom contained no toiletries, simply a tiny bar of soap and half a roll of cheap toilet paper. There was no shampoo!!! If I wanted to take my own toiletries I would have used a youth hostel and paid £20 for the night, not the £120 here. There were quite a few dodgy hairs lying around as well. As a business traveller I want a room that is functional. The room has no ironing board, it contains a very cheap uncomfortable plastic chair, and the wifi doesnt work very well. The TV, although flatscreen points straight at the bed and cant be moved. There is no information as to what the different channels are. I ate in the restaurant which actually wasnt too bad and the prices reasonable. Portion sizes were rather small. I noted the poster in the lift advising that if you turned up for breakfast after 8 it would be chaos.....so I was down there at 0715.....nice and quiet with lots of hot food.....only downsides - horrible re-constituted scrambled egg, fruit juice so watered down it tasted of water only and horrible machine coffee made with powders...... I survived but wouldnt rush back....there are much better hotels in the area for a slightly lower price.....

Reviews.Title: “Good basic no-frills hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Surby_Girl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a Saturday night - we had to book at short notice so didn't benefit from the cheapest rates however it was still very good value for money and much nicer than other hotels in central London with similar rates. The hotel is very conveniently located close to both Old Street and Moorgate underground stations. I had no problems with the self-service check-in kiosks which were quick and easy to use. The room itself was spartan but perfectly clean and surprisingly large. I was in room 446 and didn't notice any road noise. Returning to the hotel late at night (about 1am) I was surprised to see a couple of burly bouncers outside the front doors but didn't see any trouble at all either inside or outside the hotel. Breakfast was manically busy (we went down at 10am) but all of the food counters were kept fully stocked and the quality and choice was very good. All in all if you don't mind a (very) basic room and the location works for you then this is a decent hotel. One slight note of caution - one of our party had their car broken into at the underground NCP close to the hotel and there were several other cars with broken windows/windscreens as well so it might be better to walk a bit further and find a more secure car park.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but shockingly awful service...”
Reviews.Author: X42316
Reviews.Content: I'll open this review by saying that I have stayed in many travelodges in my time - they offer a very cheap nights sleep by having a business model that involves only giving customers the bare essentials and hiring minimal staff (I'll also mention at this point that all the staff at this hotel are foreign). For a hotel in London, where most people are likely to only be in their hotel in the morning and night, a travelodge is ideal, but there were a few problems with the service in this hotel that resulted in me only rewarding it 3 stars. FIrst, check in was a joke. We arrived after a long train journey at 2:30pm and were told by the single receptionist that check in was at 3pm - a mere 30 minutes away. Instead of simply allowing us to check in at that time, she very abruptly told us that we have to either pay a £10 charge to check in early or wait until 3pm. Needless to say we did the latter and sat around in the reception area like idiots, along with the many other guests, while we waited for the elusive 3 O clock hour.
